(1) What words modify an attribute?|(1) Watter woorde verander &#39;n kenmerk?
fairly, sort of, quite,|redelik, soort van, heel,
Semantic constituents related to verbs|Semantiese bestanddele wat verband hou met werkwoorde
Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that modify verbs.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir verbale hulpwerkwoorde, affixes, bywoorde en deeltjies wat werkwoorde verander.
Tense and aspect|Tyd en aspek
Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate tense and aspect.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir verbale hulpwerkwoorde, affixes, bywoorde en deeltjies wat tyd en aspek aan te dui.
Tense|Gespanne
Use this domain for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate tense (also known as temporal deixis)--the time of a situation (event, activity, or state) in relation to a reference point, which is usually the time of utterance. The following definitions are taken from Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca. 1994. The evolution of grammar. Chicago and London: University of Chicago Press.|Gebruik hierdie domein verbale hulpwerkwoorde, affixes, bywoorde en deeltjies wat tyd (ook bekend as tydelike Deixis) dui - die tyd van &#39;n situasie (event, aktiwiteit, of staat) met betrekking tot &#39;n verwysingspunt, wat gewoonlik die tyd van die woord. Die volgende definisies is geneem uit Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, en William Pagliuca. 1994. Die evolusie van grammatika. Chicago en Londen: Universiteit van Chicago Press.
(1) present: the situation occurs simultaneously with the moment of speech.|(1) teenwoordig: die situasie gelyktydig plaasvind met die oomblik van spraak.
(2) past: the situation occurred before the moment of speech.|(2) verlede: die situasie plaasgevind het voor die oomblik van spraak.
(3) future: the situation takes place after the moment of speech; the speaker predicts that the situation in the proposition will hold.|(3) toekoms: die situasie vind plaas nadat die oomblik van spraak; die spreker voorspel dat die situasie in die stelling sal hou.
(4) crastinal: tomorrow.|(4) crastinal: môre.
(5) hesternal: yesterday.|(5) hesternal: gister.
(6) hodiernal: today, normally with past.|(6) hodiernal vandag, gewoonlik met die verlede.
(7) pre-hodiernal: before today.|(7) pre-hodiernal: voor vandag.
(8) post-crastinal: after tomorrow.|(8) post-crastinal: na môre.
(9) ancient past: used for narrating events in ancient or mythical time.|(9) antieke verlede: wat gebruik word vir narrating gebeure in die antieke of mitiese tyd.
(10) remote: combines with other tense labels to indicate a situation occurring temporally distant from the moment of speech.|(10) remote: kombineer met ander gespanne etikette aan te dui &#39;n situasie voorkom tydelik ver van die oomblik van spraak.
(11) immediate: a meaning label that may be combined with other tense labels to indicate a situation not simultaneous with the moment of speech, but very close to it.|(11) onmiddellik: &#39;n betekenis etiket wat kan gekombineer word met ander gespanne etikette om &#39;n situasie nie gelyktydig met die oomblik van spraak, maar baie naby aan dit aan te dui.
(12) immediate future: what is about to occur.|(12) onmiddellike toekoms: Wat is oor om te voorkom.
(13) immediate past: occurring immediately before the moment of speech. Also called the Recent Past. Do not use this label if there is any sense of current relevance--use anterior for that.|(13) onmiddellike verlede: onmiddellik plaasvind voor die oomblik van spraak. Ook bekend as die onlangse verlede. Moenie hierdie etiket gebruik nie of daar enige sin van die huidige relevansie - gebruik anterior vir daardie.
(14) Immediate may also be combined with anterior or imperative.|(14) Onmiddellike kan ook gekombineer word met anterior of noodsaaklik.
(15) expected future: the situation is to occur in the near future; what is scheduled to happen.|(15) verwag toekoms: die situasie is om plaas te vind in die nabye toekoms; wat is geskeduleer om te gebeur.
(16) narrative time: the use of a form with no other past uses for reporting a past narrative.|(16) vertelling tyd: die gebruik van &#39;n vorm met geen ander afgelope gebruik vir die teken van &#39;n verlede verhaal.
(17) gnomic present: the situation described in the proposition is generic; the predicate has held, holds, and will hold for the class of entities named by the subject, such as 'Elephants have trunks'.|(17) gnomisch teenwoordig: die in die stelling beskryf situasie is generiese; die gesegde gehou het, hou, en sal hou vir die klas van entiteite naam wat deur die onderwerp, soos &#39;Olifante het stamme.
(18) What general words refer to the tense of an event?|(18) Watter algemene woorde verwys na die tyd van &#39;n gebeurtenis?
tense, time|gespanne, tyd
(19) What words are used to indicate the present tense?|(19) Watter woorde word gebruik om die huidige gespanne dui?
(no words or affixes in English)|(Geen woorde of affixes in Engels)
(20) What words are used to indicate the past tense?|(20) Watter woorde word gebruik om die verlede tyd aan te dui?
-ed, (in English vowel replacement is also used to indicate past tense, e.g. run, ran)|ed, (in Engels vokaal vervanging word ook gebruik om die verlede tyd, bv run dui, hardloop)
(21) What words are used to indicate the future tense?|(21) Watter woorde word gebruik om die toekomstige tyd aan te dui?
will, going to|sal, gaan
Aspect--dynamic verbs|Aspek - dinamiese werkwoorde
Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate aspects of dynamic verbs. Aspects describe the temporal contours of a situation. They may be combined with any of the tenses, either in the same morpheme or in combinations of morphemes. The following definitions are taken from Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca. 1994. The evolution of grammar. Chicago and London: University of Chicago Press.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir verbale hulpwerkwoorde, affixes, bywoorde en deeltjies wat aspekte van dinamiese werkwoorde dui. Aspekte beskryf die temporale kontoere van &#39;n situasie. Hulle kan gekombineer word met enige van die tye, óf in dieselfde morfeem of in kombinasies van morfeme. Die volgende definisies is geneem uit Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, en William Pagliuca. 1994. Die evolusie van grammatika. Chicago en Londen: Universiteit van Chicago Press.
(1) habitual: the situation is customary or usual, repeated on different occasion over a period of time. English 'used to' is past habitual; English 'Nancy sings' is present habitual.|(1) gewoontemisdadiger: die situasie is gebruiklik of gewone, herhaal op verskillende geleentheid oor &#39;n tydperk van die tyd. Engels &#39;gebruik om&#39; is verlede gewoontemisdadiger; Engels &#39;Nancy sing&#39; is teenwoordig gewoontemisdadiger.
(2) continuous: a single situation is viewed as in progress, as maintained over a period of time; also called "durative." The English "Progressive" is a continuous restricted to dynamic words. English 'I am reading; *I am knowing the number'.|(2) deurlopende: &#39;n enkele situasie word beskou as in die gang, as gehandhaaf oor &#39;n tydperk van die tyd; ook genoem &quot;durative.&quot; Die Engelse &quot;progressiewe&quot; is &#39;n deurlopende beperk tot dinamiese woorde. Engels &quot;Ek lees; * Ek weet die aantal.
(3) continuative: keep on doing what is being done. Restricted to dynamic words.|(3) continuative: aanhou doen wat gedoen word. Beperk tot dinamiese woorde.
(4) progressive: the action takes place simultaneously with the moment of reference, 'to be in the process of...'. This is more restricted than the English Progressive, which may be used for events that are not actually in progress at reference time: 'I am writing a book' may be used even if the speaker is not at that moment writing.|(4) progressiewe: die aksie vind plaas gelyktydig met die oomblik van verwysing, &quot;om te wees in die proses van ...&quot;. Dit is meer beperk as die Engelse Progressive, wat gebruik kan word vir die gebeure wat nie eintlik aan die gang by verwysing tyd: &quot;Ek skryf &#39;n boek&quot; kan selfs gebruik word as die spreker is nie op daardie oomblik skryf.
(5) excessive duration: action is extended over a long period of time, longer than normal for that action.|(5) oormatige duur: optrede word oor &#39;n lang tydperk van die tyd, langer as normaal vir die aksie.
(6) limited duration: action performed for a relatively short or bounded period of time.|(6) beperkte duur: aksie uitgevoer word vir &#39;n relatief kort of begrensde tyd.
(7) iterative: the action is repeated on one occasion; usually restricted to dynamic words, often further restricted to semelfactive words.|(7) iteratiewe: die aksie herhaal word op een geleentheid; gewoonlik beperk tot dinamiese woorde, dikwels verder beperk tot semelfactive woorde.
(8) frequentative: action occurs frequently, not necessarily habitually, nor necessarily on one occasion, as is the iterative.|(8) frequentative: optrede kom dikwels, nie noodwendig gewoonlik nie noodwendig op een geleentheid, soos die iteratiewe.
(9) imperfective: the situation is viewed as unbounded in the sense that it is habitual, continuous, progressive, or iterative.|(9) onvoltooid: die situasie word beskou as ongeleide in die sin dat dit gewoontemisdadiger, deurlopende, progressiewe, of iteratiewe.
(10) perfective: the situation is viewed as bounded temporally. It cannot be simultaneous with the moment of speech; in the non-past it is sometimes interpreted as future.|(10) perfective: die situasie word beskou as tydelik begrens. Dit kan nie gelyktydig met die oomblik van spraak wees; in die nie-verlede soms geïnterpreteer as toekoms.
(11) completive: to do something thoroughly and to completion, e.g. 'to shoot someone dead, to eat up'.|(11) kompletief: deeglik en tot voltooiing iets te doen, soos &quot;om iemand dood is, om te eet skiet.
(12) inceptive: the action or event begins. We are distinguishing this from the beginning of a state.|(12) opwekkend: die handeling of gebeurtenis begin. Ons onderskei dit van die begin van &#39;n staat.
(13) delimited: action is performed only a little.|(13) afgebaken: optrede word slegs uitgevoer &#39;n bietjie.
(14) The preceding terms or "Aspects" are not usually relevant to stative words.|(14) Die voorafgaande bepalings of &quot;Aspekte&quot; is gewoonlik nie relevant om woorde statiewe.
(15) What general words refer to an aspect of an event?|(15) Watter algemene woorde verwys na &#39;n aspek van &#39;n gebeurtenis?
aspect|aspek
(16) What words are used to indicate that something has begun?|(16) Watter woorde word gebruik om aan te dui dat iets begin?
begin, start, commence, beginning, the start, commencement, initiate, to institute, inception|begin, begin, begin, begin, die begin, aanvang, begin, in te stel, ontstaan
(17) What do people say when they want someone else to start?|(17) Wat sê die mense wanneer hulle wil iemand anders om te begin?
(18) What is a person called who starts something?|(18) Wat is &#39;n persoon genoem wat iets begin?
(19) What words are used to indicate that someone is attempting to do something?|(19) Watter woorde word gebruik om aan te dui dat iemand probeer om iets te doen?
try, attempt|probeer, probeer
(20) What words are used to indicate that something is being done quickly?|(20) Watter woorde word gebruik om dat iets word vinnig gedoen dui?
quick, quickly, rapidly|vinnig, vinnig, vinnig
(21) What words are used to indicate that something happened suddenly?|(21) Watter woorde word gebruik om aan te dui dat iets skielik gebeur?
sudden, suddenly, suddenness, immediate|skielike, skielik, onverwags, onmiddellike
(22) What words are used to indicate something is continuing?|(22) Watter woorde word gebruik om iets aan te dui voort?
continue, continuous, keep on|voortgaan, deurlopende, hou op
(23) What words are used to indicate that something has been completed?|(23) Watter woorde word gebruik om aan te dui dat daar iets is voltooi?
complete, finish, succeed|volledige, afwerking, slaag
Aspect--stative verbs|Aspek - statiewe werkwoorde
Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate aspects of stative verbs. Aspects describe the temporal contours of a situation. They may be combined with any of the tenses, either in the same morpheme or in combinations of morphemes. The following definitions are taken from Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca. 1994. The evolution of grammar. Chicago and London: University of Chicago Press.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir verbale hulpwerkwoorde, affixes, bywoorde en deeltjies wat aspekte van statiewe werkwoorde dui. Aspekte beskryf die temporale kontoere van &#39;n situasie. Hulle kan gekombineer word met enige van die tye, óf in dieselfde morfeem of in kombinasies van morfeme. Die volgende definisies is geneem uit Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, en William Pagliuca. 1994. Die evolusie van grammatika. Chicago en Londen: Universiteit van Chicago Press.
(1) state exists: the state is begun before reference time and continues after reference time.|(1) meld bestaan: die staat is begin voordat verwysing tyd en gaan voort na verwys tyd.
is,|is,
(2) state commences: beginning of a state of "becoming." Often called Inceptive or Inchoative. If there is a morpheme specifically for this meaning, it is usually derivational and restricted to stative words. However, it is also possible for "Perfects" or "Perfectives" to have this as their use with stative words.|(2) meld begin: begin van &#39;n toestand van &quot;om.&quot; Dikwels genoem opwekkend of kiem. As daar &#39;n morfeem wat spesifiek vir hierdie betekenis, is dit gewoonlik afgeleide en beperk tot woorde statiewe. Dit is egter ook moontlik vir &quot;perfects&quot; of &quot;Perfectives&quot; om dit as hul gebruik met statiewe woorde.
becoming,|besig,
(3) state ends: state existed in the past, but no longer exists. Also a possible meaning of "Perfects" or "Perfectives" in combination with stative words.|(3) meld eindig: staat bestaan ​​het in die verlede, maar nie meer bestaan ​​nie. Ook &#39;n moontlike betekenis van &quot;perfects&quot; of &quot;Perfectives&quot; in kombinasie met statiewe woorde.
no longer,|nie meer nie,
(4) state continues: state is continuing a reference time.|(4) meld verder: staat voortsetting van &#39;n verwysing tyd.
still,|steeds,
(5) state changes: (self-explanatory).|(5) meld veranderinge: (selfverduidelikend).
turn,|draai,
Relational tenses|Relasionele tye
Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate relational tenses. Relational tenses describe situations where the reference time is not the same as the moment of speech. They may be combined with any of the tenses, either in the same morpheme or in combinations of morphemes. The following definitions are taken from Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca. 1994. The evolution of grammar. Chicago and London: University of Chicago Press.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir verbale hulpwerkwoorde, affixes, bywoorde en deeltjies wat relasionele tye aan te dui. Relasionele tye beskryf situasies waar die verwysing tyd is nie dieselfde as die oomblik van spraak. Hulle kan gekombineer word met enige van die tye, óf in dieselfde morfeem of in kombinasies van morfeme. Die volgende definisies is geneem uit Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, en William Pagliuca. 1994. Die evolusie van grammatika. Chicago en Londen: Universiteit van Chicago Press.
(1) resulting state (resultative): action in the past produces a state that persists into the present.|(1) gevolg staat (resultative): optrede in die verlede produseer &#39;n staat wat voortduur in die hede.
be... -en,|wees ... -en,
(2) anterior continuing: past action continues into the present: 'I have waited over an hour' ( = and I'm still waiting).|(2) anterior voortgesette: verlede aksie gaan voort in die hede: &quot;Ek het gewag oor &#39;n uur (= en ek is nog steeds wag).
have been... -ing,|gewees ... -ing,
(3) anterior: the situation occurs prior to reference time, and is relevant to the situation at reference time. This is different from a simple past or perfective, where the situation is reported for its own sake and independent of its relevance to any other situation.|(3) anterior: die situasie ontstaan ​​voor verwys tyd, en om die situasie by verwysing tyd relevant is. Dit is anders as &#39;n eenvoudige verlede of perfective, waar die situasie is gerapporteer vir sy eie onthalwe en onafhanklik van die relevansie daarvan vir enige ander situasie.
have... -en,|het ... -en,
(4) A form that signals a situation that is prior to and relevant to a past reference time will be coded with two meaning labels, past and anterior.|(4) &#39;n vorm wat &#39;n situasie wat voor en na &#39;n verlede verwysing tyd relevant sal gekodeer word met twee beteken etikette, die verlede en die anterior seine.
had... -en,|het ... -en,
Agent-oriented modalities|Agent-georiënteerd modaliteite
Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate agent-oriented modalities. Agent-oriented modalities describe internal or external conditions on a willful agent with respect to the completion of the predicate situation. They may be combined with any of the tenses, either in the same morpheme or in combinations of morphemes. The following definitions are taken from Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca. 1994. The evolution of grammar. Chicago and London: University of Chicago Press.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir verbale hulpwerkwoorde, affixes, bywoorde en deeltjies wat-agent georiënteerde modaliteite aan te dui. Agent-georiënteerd modaliteite beskryf interne of eksterne omstandighede op &#39;n opsetlike agent met betrekking tot die voltooiing van die gesegde situasie. Hulle kan gekombineer word met enige van die tye, óf in dieselfde morfeem of in kombinasies van morfeme. Die volgende definisies is geneem uit Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, en William Pagliuca. 1994. Die evolusie van grammatika. Chicago en Londen: Universiteit van Chicago Press.
(1) ability: the agent of the verb has the mental or physical ability to complete the action of the main verb.|(1) vermoë: die agent van die werkwoord het die geestelike of fisiese vermoë om die optrede van die hoofwerkwoord voltooi.
(2) ability, mental: English: 'Melissa can speak Dutch'.|(2) die vermoë, geestelike: Engels: &quot;Melissa kan Nederlands te praat.
can,|kan,
(3) ability, physical: English: 'Hortense can swim the English Channel'.|(3) vermoë, fisiese: Engels: &quot;Hortense kan swem die Engelse Kanaal.
(4) attempt: the agent attempts to complete the action specified by the predicate. Note: this has a sense of incompleteness, and I have seen authors call this "Incomplete" and gloss the examples with 'try'.|(4) probeer: die agent poog om die aksie wat deur die predikaat te voltooi. Let wel: dit het &#39;n gevoel van onvoltooidheid, en ek het gesien skrywers noem dit &quot;Onvoltooid&quot; en glans die voorbeelde met &#39;probeer&#39;.
try to, attempt to,|probeer om, probeer om,
(5) desire: the agent of the verb desires or wants to complete the action of the verb.|(5) wil: die agent van die werkwoord begeer of wil die optrede van die werkwoord te voltooi.
want to, would like to,|wil, wil,
(6) obligation: the agent is obliged to perform the action of the verb.|(6) verpligting: die agent verplig is om die optrede van die werkwoord te voer.
(7) obligation, strong: it is absolutely incumbent upon the agent to complete the action of the main verb: 'I have to mail this letter today'.|(7) verpligting, &#39;n sterk: dit is absoluut die plig van die agent aan die optrede van die hoofwerkwoord voltooi: &quot;Ek moet pos hierdie brief vandag.
have to, must,|moet, moet,
(8) obligation, weak: it is recommended that the agent complete the action of the main verb: 'Harry ought to get a haircut before meeting Sue's mother'.|(8) verpligting, swak: Dit word aanbeveel dat die agent voltooi die optrede van die hoofwerkwoord: &#39;Harry moet &#39;n haarsny kry voor die vergadering Sue se moeder.
ought to, should,|behoort te gaan, moet,
(9) permission: the agent is allowed to complete the action of the main verb: 'The students may check books out for two weeks'.|(9) toestemming: die agent toegelaat word om die optrede van die hoofwerkwoord voltooi: &quot;Die studente kan boeke vir twee weke gaan.
may,|kan,
(10) root possibility: it is possible for the agent to carry out the action of the main verb; i.e. s/he is able and external conditions allow it: 'You can get that kind of paper at Ulbrich's'.|(10) wortel moontlikheid: dit is moontlik vir die agent om uit te voer die aksie van die hoofwerkwoord; dws hy / sy in staat is om en eksterne omstandighede dit toelaat: &quot;Jy kan nie daardie soort papier op Ulbrich kry.
(11) intention: the agent intends to carry out the action of the main verb: 'Sam's gonna take Sanskrit next semester'.|(11) se bedoeling: die agent beoog om uit te voer die aksie van die hoofwerkwoord: &quot;Sam se gaan neem Sanskrit volgende semester.
gonna, going to, intend to,|gaan, gaan, van plan is om,
(12) andative: agent moves away from the deictic center in order to do something, literally 'be going to do something'. Of course such forms are often related to the verb 'to go' and also may have uses of intention and future.|(12) andative: agent beweeg weg van die deiktiese sentrum om iets te doen, letterlik &quot;gaan om iets te doen. Natuurlik sulke vorme, word dikwels in verband met die werkwoord &#39;om te gaan &quot;en kan ook gebruik van voorneme en toekoms.
go to,|gaan,
(13) venitive: the agent moves toward the deictic center in order to do something, literally 'be coming to do something'. This may be related to the verb 'to come' and may have future uses as well.|(13) venitive: die agent beweeg na die deiktiese sentrum om iets te doen, letterlik &quot;kom om iets te doen. Dit kan verband hou met die werkwoord &#39;om te kom en dalk toekomstige gebruik as well.
come to,|kom,
Can|Kan
Use this domain for words indicating that someone can do something.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat iemand iets kan doen.
(1) What words indicate that someone is able to do something?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iemand in staat is om iets te doen?
can, know how to, be able to, have the ability to, capable,|kan weet hoe om in staat wees om, het die vermoë om in staat,
(2) What words refer to the ability of someone to do something?|(2) Watter woorde verwys na die vermoë van iemand om iets te doen?
ability, capability, prowess,|vermoë, vermoë, bekwaamheid,
(3) What words indicate that someone is not able to do something?|(3) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iemand nie in staat is om iets te doen?
inability, unable, incapable,|onvermoë, nie, nie in staat is,
Can't|Kan nie
Use this domain for words related to being incapable of doing something.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde in verband met nie in staat is om iets te doen.
(1) What words describe a person's inability to do a job?|(1) Watter woorde beskryf &#39;n persoon se onvermoë om &#39;n werk te doen?
can't do something, not be able to do something, cannot, be incapable of, not be capable of, be unable to do something, someone's inability to do something, incompetent, unqualified, unfitted, untrained, not be equipped, be ill-equipped, powerless,|kan nie iets doen nie, nie in staat wees om iets te doen, kan nie wees in staat, nie in staat wees nie, nie in staat is om iets te doen, iemand se onvermoë om iets te doen, onbevoeg, ongekwalifiseerde, ingericht, onopgeleide doen, nie toegerus, sleg -equipped, magteloos,
(2) What words refer to a person's inability to do a job?|(2) Watter woorde verwys na &#39;n persoon se onvermoë om &#39;n werk te doen?
incapacity, incompetence, inability, deficiency, lack of training|onbekwaamheid, ongeskiktheid, onvermoë, tekort, gebrek aan opleiding
Necessary|Nodig
Use this domain for words that a speaker uses to indicate that he thinks something must happen.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat &#39;n spreker gebruik om aan te dui dat hy dink iets moet gebeur.
(1) What words indicate that something is necessary?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets nodig?
must, need to, have to, have got to|moet moet, het aan, het om
(2) What words describe something that is necessary?|(2) Watter woorde iets wat nodig is te beskryf?
necessary, compulsory, essential, imperative, indispensable, inevitable, mandatory, obligatory, required, unavoidable, urgent, vital,|nodig, verpligte, wat noodsaaklik is, noodsaaklik, onontbeerlik, onvermydelik, verpligte, verpligtend, vereis word, onvermydelik, dringende, noodsaaklike,
(3) What words refer to something that is necessary?|(3) Watter woorde verwys na iets wat nodig is?
necessity, need, obligation, prerequisite, requirement,|noodsaaklikheid, behoefte, verpligting, vereiste, vereiste,
(4) What words describe something that is not necessary?|(4) Watter woorde iets wat nie nodig is nie, beskryf?
unnecessary, extraneous, incidental, inessential, needless, nonessential, uncalled-for, unessential, unnecessary, unneeded,|onnodige, vreemde, toevallige, essensieel, onnodige, nonessential, ongevraagde, unessential, onnodige, onnodige,
Moods|Buie
Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate moods.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir verbale hulpwerkwoorde, affixes, bywoorde en deeltjies wat buie aan te dui.
Imperative|Noodsaaklik
Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate imperatives. The following definitions are taken from Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca. 1994. The evolution of grammar. Chicago and London: University of Chicago Press. Use this domain for words and affixes that a speaker uses to indicate that he is making a command. English has no command word. Some languages change the form of the verb by adding an affix. Some languages have special verbs that are only or normally used as commands. Those verbs could be classified here.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir verbale hulpwerkwoorde, affixes, bywoorde en deeltjies wat imperatiewe aan te dui. Die volgende definisies is geneem uit Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, en William Pagliuca. 1994. Die evolusie van grammatika. Chicago en Londen: Universiteit van Chicago Press. Gebruik hierdie domein woorde en affixes dat &#39;n spreker gebruik om aan te dui dat hy &#39;n opdrag. Engels het geen opdrag woord. Sommige tale verander die vorm van die werkwoord deur die toevoeging van &#39;n affiks. Sommige tale het &#39;n spesiale werkwoorde wat net of normaalweg gebruik word as opdragte. Diegene werkwoorde kan hier geklassifiseer.
(1) imperative: the verb form used for direct commands in the 2nd person. If there are also 1st and 3rd person forms, the meaning can still be that of imperative, with the 1st and 3rd persons being interpreted as 'Let us, let him...', etc.|(1) noodsaaklik: die werkwoord vorm wat gebruik word vir direkte opdragte in die 2de persoon. As daar is ook 1 en 3 persoon vorms, kan die betekenis steeds dié van imperatief, met die 1ste en 3de persone as dit vertaal word as &quot;Laat ons het, laat hom ...&quot;, ens
(2) optative: the proposition represents the speaker's will. Translated into English as 'May you prosper', 'May we all meet again.' with counterfactual: 'If only he had...', etc.|(2) wensend: die stelling verteenwoordig die wil van die spreker se. In Engels vertaal as &quot;Mag jy voorspoedig&quot;, &quot;Mag ons almal weer ontmoet.&quot; met counterfactual: &quot;As hy ...&quot;, ens
(3) hortative: the speaker is encouraging or inciting someone to action.|(3) Leerstellig: die spreker is bemoedigend of aanhitsing iemand tot aksie.
(4) prohibitive: the mood for expressing negative commands. The English is 'Don't'.|(4) verbod: die bui vir die uitdrukking van negatiewe opdragte. Die Engelse is &#39;Moenie&#39;.
(5) admonitive: the command constitutes a warning: 'you had better not...'.|(5) admonitive: die opdrag maak &#39;n waarskuwing: &quot;jy beter nie gehad het ...&quot;.
(6) Meanings co-occurring with imperative:|(6) Betekenis saam voorkom met noodsaaklik:
(7) polite: a mild or polite form of command.|(7) beleefd: &#39;n ligte of beleefde vorm van opdrag.
(8) delayed: the action of the command is to be carried out in the future rather than immediately.|(8) vertraag: die optrede van die bevel is in die toekoms uit te voer, eerder as onmiddellik.
(9) immediate: the action of the command is to be carried out immediately.|(9) onmiddellik: die optrede van die opdrag is om onmiddellik uitgevoer word.
(10) strong: (self-explanatory).|(10) &#39;n sterk (selfverduidelikend).
(11) What words indicate that the sentence is a command?|(11) Watter woorde aan te dui dat die vonnis is &#39;n opdrag?
(12) What affixes indicate that the sentence is a command?|(12) Wat affixes dui dat die vonnis is &#39;n opdrag?
(none in English), (in many Bantu languages) -e  'a verbal suffix indicating that the sentence is a command'|(Niemand in Engels), (in baie Bantoetale) -e &#39;n verbale agtervoegsel wat aandui dat die vonnis is &#39;n opdrag &#39;
(13) What words are only used in the imperative?|(13) Watter woorde word slegs gebruik in die imperatief?
whoa (stop)|whoa (stop)
Hortative|Leerstellig
Use this domain for ways of saying that someone should do something. If I say someone should do something, I think it is good that he does it.|Gebruik hierdie domein maniere om te sê dat iemand iets moet doen. As ek sê as iemand iets te doen, ek dink dit is goed dat hy dit doen.
(1) What words indicate that the speaker is encouraging or inciting someone to action.|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat die spreker is bemoedigend of aanhitsing iemand tot aksie.
urge, request, let, why don't, please|moedig, versoek, laat, waarom nie, asseblief
(2) What words indicate that something should be done?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets gedoen moet word?
should, ought to, be responsible for, be duty bound,|moet, behoort te wees wat verantwoordelik is vir, wees verplig,
(3) What words indicate that something should not be done?|(3) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets nie gedoen moet word?
should not, ought not to, caution|moet nie, behoort nie te, versigtigheid
(4) What words refer to something a person should do?|(4) Wat woorde verwys na iets wat &#39;n mens moet doen?
duty, responsibility, obligation, onus, requirement,|plig, verantwoordelikheid, plig, onus, vereiste,
(5) What words describe the person who should do something?|(5) Watter woorde beskryf die persoon wat iets moet doen?
responsible,|verantwoordelike,
(6) What words describe someone who does what he should?|(6) Watter woorde iemand wat doen wat hy moet beskryf?
dutiful, responsible|pligsgetrou, verantwoordelik
Interrogative|Vraende
Use this domain for words that a speaker uses to indicate that he is asking a question. English has no question word, but other languages such as Japanese do.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat &#39;n spreker gebruik om aan te dui dat hy &#39;n vraag vra. Engels het geen twyfel woord nie, maar ander tale soos Japanese doen.
(1) What words indicate that the sentence is a question?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat die vonnis is &#39;n vraag?
(Japanese) ka?  'a particle coming at the end of a sentence to indicate that it is a question'|(Japanese) ka? &#39;N deeltjie kom aan die einde van &#39;n sin om aan te dui dat dit &#39;n vraag: &quot;
(2) English has an interjection that is added to a statement that has the effect of questioning something about it.|(2) Engels het &#39;n tussenwerpsel wat bygevoeg om &#39;n verklaring dat die effek van die ondervraging iets oor dit.
Epistemic moods|Epistemiese buie
Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate epistemic moods. Epistemic moods have the whole proposition in their scope and indicate the degree of commitment of the speaker to the truth or future truth of the proposition. They may be combined with any of the tenses, either in the same morpheme or in combinations of morphemes. The following definitions are taken from Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca. 1994. The evolution of grammar. Chicago and London: University of Chicago Press.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir verbale hulpwerkwoorde, affixes, bywoorde en deeltjies wat epistemiese buie aan te dui. Epistemiese buie het die hele stelling in hul omvang en dui die graad van verbintenis van die speaker om die waarheid of toekomstige waarheid van die stelling. Hulle kan gekombineer word met enige van die tye, óf in dieselfde morfeem of in kombinasies van morfeme. Die volgende definisies is geneem uit Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, en William Pagliuca. 1994. Die evolusie van grammatika. Chicago en Londen: Universiteit van Chicago Press.
(1) possibility: the speaker is indicating that the situation described in the proposition is possibly true. Some markers with this meaning also indicate future time: 'He may arrive late because of the weather; It may snow again tomorrow; She could have already taken it'.|(1) moontlikheid: die spreker wat aandui dat die in die stelling beskryf situasie is moontlik waar. Sommige merkers met hierdie betekenis dui ook toekomstige tyd: &quot;Hy kan laat kom as gevolg van die weer; Dit kan sneeu môre weer; Sy reeds kon geneem het dit.
may, could,|Mei kon,
(2) probability: the speaker is indicating that the situation described in the proposition is probably true. Some marker with this meaning also indicate future time. This is sometimes called the "Dubitative" in grammars: 'Paula should be home by now'.|(2) waarskynlikheid: die spreker wat aandui dat die in die stelling beskryf situasie is waarskynlik waar. Sommige merker met hierdie betekenis dui ook toekomstige tyd. Dit word soms die &quot;twijfelachtig&quot; in grammatikas: &quot;Paula moet die huis te wees deur die nou.
should,|moet,
(3) inferred certainty: the speaker infers from evidence that the proposition is true: 'They must have killed a bear here (I can see blood on the snow)'.|(3) afgeleide sekerheid: die spreker afleidings uit &#39;n bewys dat die stelling is waar: &quot;Hulle moet &#39;n beer hier vermoor (ek kan die bloed op die sneeu sien).
must have,|moet,
(4) certainty: the speaker is emphasizing that the proposition is true.|(4) sekerheid: die spreker beklemtoon dat die stelling is waar.
certainly,|beslis,
(5) uncertainty: the speaker is emphasizing that s/he doesn't know that the proposition is true.|(5) onsekerheid: die spreker beklemtoon dat hy / sy nie weet dat die stelling is waar.
might,|mag,
(6) indicative: main clause mood that also appears in questions. Contrasts with subjunctive, conditional, and imperative.|(6) &#39;n aanduiding: hoofsin bui wat ook in vrae. Kontras met subjunktief, voorwaardelike en noodsaaklik.
[none in English]|[Niemand in Engels]
Certainly, definitely|Sekerlik, beslis
Use this domain for words that a speaker uses to indicate that he thinks something is certainly true or is certain to happen.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat &#39;n spreker gebruik om aan te dui dat hy dink iets is seker waar of is sekere om te gebeur.
(1) What words indicate that something is certainly true?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat daar iets is sekerlik waar?
certainly, absolutely, definitely, there is no doubt, undoubtedly, without a doubt, without doubt, without a shadow of a doubt, unquestionably, be beyond dispute, there's no denying, there are no two ways about it, there is no question|beslis, absoluut, beslis, is daar geen twyfel, ongetwyfeld, sonder twyfel, sonder twyfel, sonder &#39;n skaduwee van &#39;n twyfel, ongetwyfeld, wees buite dispuut, daar is geen ontken, is daar geen twee maniere oor dit, is daar geen twyfel
(2) What words indicate that something will certainly happen?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets beslis sal gebeur?
certainly, definitely, be bound to, be sure to, be certain to, be assured of, be only a matter of time, be just a matter of time, cut and dried, you can bet your life, you can bet your bottom dollar, be a certainty, be a foregone conclusion, for sure|beslis, definitief, gebind te wees, is seker te wees om sekere, verseker wees van, wees net &#39;n kwessie van tyd, net &#39;n kwessie van tyd, sny en droog is, kan jy jou lewe wed, kan jy jou bottom dollar wed , &#39;n sekerheid, &#39;n uitgemaakte saak, vir seker
(3) What words indicate that something will certainly succeed?|(3) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets beslis sal slaag?
can't go wrong, be a dead cert, it's in the bag, it's a safe bet, it's a sure bet, foolproof|kan nie verkeerd gaan, word &#39;n dooie sert, dit is in die sak, dit is &#39;n veilige weddenskap, dit is &#39;n seker verbintenis, onfeilbaar
(4) What words refer to doing something in order to be certain that something will happen?|(4) Wat woorde verwys na iets te doen ten einde seker dat daar iets sal gebeur om te wees?
make sure, make certain, insure, ensure, see that, see to it|maak seker, maak seker, verseker, verseker, sien dat, toe te sien
(5) What words indicate that something is certain to happen and nothing can be done to stop it?|(5) Watter woorde aan te dui dat daar iets is om te gebeur en sekere niks gedoen kan word om dit te stop?
inevitable, whether you like it or not, willy nilly, be fated to, be destined to, predestined, be meant to be, pre-ordained, doomed, the inevitable|onvermydelik, of jy daarvan hou of nie, Willy teen wil en dank, word bestem te word bestem om, vantevore verordineer het, word bedoel om te wees, pre-geordende, gedoem, die onvermydelike
(6) What words describe something that is certain?|(6) Watter woorde iets wat sekere beskryf?
certain, definite, conclusive|sekere, definitiewe, afdoende
(7) What words indicate that something is certainly not true?|(7) Wat woorde aan te dui dat daar iets is beslis nie waar nie?
absolute, assurance, assured, can, certain, certainly, certitude, clear, decided, decisive, definite, doubtless, established, fixed, guaranteed, incalculable, incontestable, incontrovertible, indisputable, indubitable, ineluctable, inevitable, infallible, inescapable, inevitable, irrefragable, irrefutable, positive, really, set, settled, single-minded, sure, sureness, trustworthy, unarguable, unavoidable, undeniable, unequivocal, unmistakable, unquestionable,|absolute, versekering, verseker, kan, seker, seker, sekerheid, duidelik, besluit, beslissende, definitiewe, beslis, gestig, vaste, gewaarborg, onberekenbare, onweerlegbare, onweerlegbare, onbetwiste, ontwyfelbare, onafwendbaar, onvermydelik, onfeilbare, onafwendbare, onvermydelik, onmiskenbare dreigende, onweerlegbare, positiewe, regtig, stel, vereffen, single-minded, seker, sureness, betroubare, unarguable, onvermydelik, onmiskenbaar, ondubbelsinnige, onmiskenbaar, onbetwisbaar,
Sure|Seker

convince|oortuig
Probably|Waarskynlik
Use this domain for words that a speaker uses to indicate that he thinks something is probable or likely to occur.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat &#39;n spreker gebruik om aan te dui dat hy dink iets is waarskynlik of waarskynlik sal plaasvind.
(1) What words indicate that something will probably happen?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets waarskynlik sal gebeur?
probably, likely, probable, be a strong possibility, it looks as if, it looks like, chances are, may well, be in the cards, as likely as not, I wouldn't be surprised if, I dare say, I should think, I guess|waarskynlik, waarskynlik, waarskynlik, &#39;n sterk moontlikheid, dit lyk asof dit lyk, is die kanse is, kan goed wees in die kaarte, meer geneig as nie, sou ek nie verbaas wees as, durf ek sê, sou ek dink, dink ek
(2) What words indicate that something is probably true?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat daar iets is waarskynlik waar?
probably, likely, probable, it looks as if, it's a fair bet, may well, may easily, as likely as not, I should think|waarskynlik, waarskynlik, waarskynlik, dit lyk asof dit &#39;n billike verbintenis, goed kan, kan maklik geneig as nie, ek moet dink
(3) What words indicate that something is very probably true|(3) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets baie waarskynlik waar
very probably, very likely, there is a strong likelihood, there is a strong probability, almost certain, be more than likely, in all probability, ten to one|heel waarskynlik, baie waarskynlik, is daar &#39;n sterk moontlikheid is, is daar &#39;n sterk waarskynlikheid, amper seker, meer as waarskynlik, in alle waarskynlikheid, 00:50
(4) What words indicate that something good will probably happen?|(4) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets goeds sal waarskynlik gebeur?
ought to be, should be, promise to be, looks promising,|behoort te wees, behoort te wees, belowe om te wees, lyk belowend,
(5) What words indicate that something bad will probably happen?|(5) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets sleg sal waarskynlik gebeur?
be heading for, be in for, threaten, threat|wees op pad na wees in vir, dreig, bedreiging
(6) What words indicate that someone or something will probably be successful?|(6) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets of iemand waarskynlik suksesvol sal wees?
have a good chance, stand a good chance, be set to do something, be on course|het &#39;n goeie kans, staan ​​&#39;n goeie kans, ingestel word om iets te doen, op koers
(7) What words indicate that someone will probably do something bad?|(7) Wat woorde aan te dui dat iemand waarskynlik iets sleg sal doen?
be quite capable of, I wouldn't put it past him|wees heeltemal in staat, sou ek nie die verlede het dit hom
(8) What words indicate how probable it is that something will happen?|(8) Watter woorde aan te dui hoe waarskynlik dit is dat iets sal gebeur?
likelihood, probability, prospect, chances, odds|waarskynlikheid, waarskynlikheid, vooruitsig, die kans, kans
(9) What words indicate that something is possible but not very probable?|(9) Watter woorde aan te dui dat daar iets is moontlik, maar nie baie waarskynlik?
unlikely, improbable, doubtful, remote|onwaarskynlik, onwaarskynlik, twyfelagtige, remote
(10) What words indicate that someone or something will probably not be successful?|(10) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets of iemand sal waarskynlik nie suksesvol wees?
little chance, little hope, little prospect, have little chance, stand little chance, outside chance|min kans, min hoop, min vooruitsig, het min kans staan ​​min kans, buitekans
Possible|Moontlik
Use this domain for words that a speaker uses to indicate that he thinks something is possible. Maybe implies that the speaker doesn't know something.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat &#39;n spreker gebruik om aan te dui dat hy dink iets is moontlik. Miskien impliseer dat die spreker nie iets weet nie.
(1) What words indicate that something is possible?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets moontlik is?
possible, possibly, could, might, may, able, maybe, perhaps, sort of, I guess so|moontlik, moontlik, kon, kan, kan, kan, dalk, miskien, soort van, ek dink so
Uncertain|Onseker
Use this domain for words that indicate that no one is certain that something is true, or when it is impossible to be certain that something is true.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat daarop dui dat niemand seker is dat iets waar is, of wanneer dit onmoontlik is om te verseker dat daar iets is waar te wees.
(1) What words indicate that something is uncertain?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets onseker is?
uncertain, not be certain, not be clear, it's up in the air, there is uncertainty|onseker, nie seker nie, nie duidelik wees, is dit in die lug, is daar onsekerheid
(2) What words indicate that something is uncertain, but it is likely that something bad will happen?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat daar iets is onseker, maar dit is waarskynlik dat iets sleg sal gebeur?
uncertain, doubtful, be in doubt, there is doubt about, it's touch and go, hang in the balance, iffy|onseker, twyfelagtige, in twyfel, is daar twyfel oor, dit is raak en gaan, hang in die balans, Iffy
(3) What words indicate that two things are equally possible?|(3) Watter woorde aan te dui dat twee dinge is ewe moontlik?
could go either way, borderline, there's a fifty-fifty chance, it's a toss-up|kon enige kant toe gaan, borderline, daar is &#39;n fifty-fifty kans, dit is &#39;n loot-up
(4) What words indicate that something is uncertain because people have many different opinions about it?|(4) Watter woorde aan te dui dat daar iets is onseker, want die mense het baie verskillende menings oor dit?
debatable, questionable, open to question, open to debate, moot point|debatteerbaar, twyfelagtige, oop te bevraagteken, oop vir debat, ope vraag
Unsure|Onseker
Use this domain for words related to not feeling sure about something or someone.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde in verband met nie voel seker oor iets of iemand.
(1) What words refer to not being sure about something?|(1) Watter woorde verwys na nie seker oor iets?
not be sure, not be certain, be unsure, be uncertain, not know, doubt, wonder, can't be sure, not be confident, be indefinite about, ambivalent|nie seker wees, nie seker, onseker, onseker, nie weet nie, twyfel, wonder, kan nie seker wees nie seker wees, wees onbepaalde oor, ambivalente
(2) What words refer to not being sure whether you should do something?|(2) Watter woorde verwys na nie seker of jy iets moet doen?
have doubts, have reservations, have misgivings, have mixed feelings, have qualms, hesitant|twyfel, het besprekings, het bedenkinge, het gemengde gevoelens, het bedenkinge, huiwerig
(3) What words refer to making someone unsure about something?|(3) Watter woorde verwys na die maak van iemand onseker is oor iets?
make someone unsure, make someone uncertain, cause doubt, cause uncertainty, it makes you wonder, raise doubts|maak iemand onseker is, maak iemand onseker, oorsaak twyfel, onsekerheid veroorsaak, dit laat jou wonder, verhoog onsekerheid
Think so|Dink so
Use this domain for words indicating that you think something is true, but you are not completely sure about it.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde aandui dat jy dink iets is waar, maar jy is nie heeltemal seker oor dit.
(1) What words indicate that you think something is true, but you are not completely sure about it?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat jy dink iets is waar, maar jy is nie heeltemal seker oor dit?
think, think it is possible, believe, bet, would gamble, would wager, guess, reckon, speculate, surmise, suspect, get the impression, have the impression, be under the impression, get the idea, feel, have the feeling, get the feeling,|dink, dink dit is moontlik, glo, verbintenis, sou dobbel, sal verbintenis, raai, reken, spekuleer, vermoed, verdagte, kry die indruk, het die indruk, onder die indruk, kry die idee, voel, het die gevoel, kry die gevoel,
(2) What words indicate that you think something is true, but you have no proof of it?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat jy dink iets is waar, maar jy het geen bewys van dit?
assume, assumption, presume, suppose, imagine, take it for granted, presumably, I take it|aanvaar, aanname, vermoed, veronderstel, dink, neem dit as vanselfsprekend, vermoedelik, ek neem dit
(3) What do you say when you think something is true, but you are not sure?|(3) Wat sê jy wanneer jy dink iets is waar, maar jy is nie seker?
I think so, I guess so, as far as I know, to the best of my knowledge, as far as I'm aware,|Ek dink nie so nie, ek dink so, sover ek weet, na die beste van my kennis, sover ek bewus is,
Maybe|Miskien
Use this domain for words that a speaker uses to indicate that he thinks it is possible that something may happen or be true, but he isn't certain.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat &#39;n spreker gebruik om aan te dui dat hy dink dit is moontlik dat iets kan gebeur of waar te wees, maar hy is nie seker nie.

Seem|Lyk
Use this domain for words indicating that something seems to be a certain way--you see (or hear) something and think something about it, but you are not sure that what you think is true.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat iets lyk na &#39;n sekere manier wees - jy sien (of hoor) iets en dink iets oor dit, maar jy is nie seker dat dit wat jy dink waar is.
(1) What words indicate that something seems to be a certain way, but you are unsure?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets lyk na &#39;n sekere manier te wees, maar jy onseker is?
seem, appear, look, sound, give the impression, have a (certain) look, come across as, show signs of, strike someone as, have all the hallmarks of, an air of, give the impression,|lyk, verskyn, kyk, klank, gee die indruk, het &#39;n (sekere) kyk, kom oor as, toon tekens van, slaan iemand as, het al die kenmerke van &#39;n lug van, gee die indruk,
(2) What words indicate that someone seems to be doing something, or something seems to be happening?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iemand lyk iets te doen, of iets blyk te wees gebeur?
seem, appear,|lyk, verskyn,
(3) What words indicate that something seems to be happening, or something seems to be true?|(3) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets blyk te wees gebeur, of iets lyk om waar te wees?
it seems, it appears, it looks as if, apparently, to all appearances, by all appearances, seemingly, on the face of it, on the surface, outwardly,|dit lyk, blyk dit, dit lyk asof, blykbaar, al optredes, deur alle optredes, skynbaar, op die gesig van dit, op die oppervlak, uiterlik,
(4) What words describe something, such as a feeling or quality, that someone or something seems to have?|(4) Watter woorde beskryf iets soos &#39;n gevoel of kwaliteit, wat iets of iemand lyk nie?
apparent, seeming, superficial,|duidelik, oënskynlike, oppervlakkig,
(5) What words indicate that, because something seems to be a certain way, you think something is true?|(5) Watter woorde aan te dui dat, omdat iets lyk na &#39;n sekere manier, jy dink iets is waar?
judging by, judging from, going by, from, from the way, you'd think, anyone would think,|oordeel, te oordeel aan, gaan deur, van, van die pad, wat jy dink, iemand sou dink,
(6) What words indicate that someone or something is not what it seems to be?|(6) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets of iemand is nie wat dit blyk te wees?
there's more to someone/something than meets the eye, deceptive, deceptively, not be what you/it seem,|daar is meer om iemand / iets as wat die oog, misleidende, bedrieglik, nie wat jy / dit voorkom,
(7) What words refer to what you think or feel because of what someone or something seems?|(7) Wat woorde verwys na wat jy dink of voel as gevolg van wat iemand of iets lyk?
impression, feeling,|indruk, gevoel,
(8) What words refer to the way something seems to appear?|(8) Wat woorde verwys na die manier waarop iets blyk te vertoon?
appearance, semblance of,|voorkoms, skyn van,
Just, almost not|Net, byna nie
Use this domain for words indicating that although something is true, it almost is not true.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat hoewel iets waar is, is dit byna nie waar nie.
(1) What words indicate that although something is true, it almost is not true?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat hoewel iets waar is, is dit byna nie waar?
just, almost didn't, nearly didn't, only just, narrowly, barely,|net, het amper nie, byna het nie, maar net, eng, skaars,
(2) What words indicate that something bad almost happened, but it did not?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets sleg byna gebeur het, maar dit het nie?
narrowly missed, close shave|naelskraap gemis, noue ontkoming
(3) What words indicate that you did something, but almost didn't do it?|(3) Watter woorde aan te dui dat jy iets gedoen het nie, maar amper het dit nie doen nie?
just, only just, barely, be a near thing, be a close thing, by the skin of your teeth|net, net, skaars, &#39;n naby ding, &#39;n noue ding, deur die vel van jou tande
(4) What words indicate that you can do something, but it is difficult?|(4) Watter woorde aan te dui dat jy iets kan doen, maar dit is moeilik?
can hardly, can barely, can scarcely|kan skaars, kan skaars, kan nouliks
(5) What words indicate that something is a particular amount, but not much more?|(5) Watter woorde aan te dui dat daar iets is &#39;n sekere hoeveelheid, maar nie veel meer nie?
just, only just, barely|net, net, skaars
Don't think so, doubt it|Dink nie so nie, glo dit
Use this domain for words indicating that you think something is unlikely to be true or to happen.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde aandui dat jy dink iets is onwaarskynlik om waar te wees of om te gebeur.
(1) What words indicate that you think it is very unlikely that something is true or will happen?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat jy dink dit is baie onwaarskynlik dat iets waar is of sal gebeur?
don't think, doubt, be doubtful, be dubious, I'd be surprised if, I think not, I wouldn't have thought so|dink nie, twyfel, te betwyfel, wees twyfelagtige, wil ek verbaas wees as ek dink nie, sou ek nie so gedink
Impossible|Onmoontlik
Use this domain for words that a speaker uses to indicate that he thinks something is impossible.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat &#39;n spreker gebruik om aan te dui dat hy dink iets is onmoontlik.
(1) What words indicate that something cannot be done?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets nie gedoen kan word?
impossible, not possible, impracticable, there's no way, out of the question, hopeless, impractical|onmoontlik, nie moontlik nie, onprakties, daar is geen manier uit van die vraag, hopeloos, onprakties
(2) What words indicate that your situation makes it impossible for you to do something?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat jou situasie maak dit onmoontlik vir jou om iets te doen?
impossible, not have a hope, not stand a chance, can't possibly, that's out, with the best will in the world, do the impossible|onmoontlik, &#39;n hoop nie, nie &#39;n kans, kan nie moontlik nie, dis uit, met die beste wil in die wêreld, doen die onmoontlike
(3) What words indicate that something cannot happen?|(3) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets nie kan gebeur?
impossible, not possible, can't, couldn't, impossibility, inconceivable, unthinkable, by any/no stretch of the imagination, there's no way|onmoontlik, nie moontlik nie, kan nie, kon nie, onmoontlik, ondenkbaar, ondenkbaar, deur enige / geen gedeelte van die verbeelding, daar is geen manier
(4) What words indicate that something is impossible to get?|(4) Watter woorde aan te dui dat daar iets is onmoontlik om te kry?
unattainable, out of reach|onbereikbaar, uit te kom
(5) What words indicate that one thing makes something else impossible?|(5) Watter woorde aan te dui dat een ding maak iets anders onmoontlik?
make something impossible, rule out, preclude|maak iets onmoontlik, uit, verhoed
(6) What words indicate that something is impossible?|(6) Watter woorde aan te dui dat daar iets is onmoontlik?
absurd, impenetrable, impervious, inaccessible, inoperable, insurmountable, no chance, no earthly way, outlandish, preposterous, ridiculous, unable, unachievable, unapproachable, undoable, unfeasible, unimaginable, unworkable,|absurd, ondeurdringbare, ondeurdringbare, ontoeganklik, in onbruik, onoorkomelike, geen kans, geen aardse manier vreemd, belaglik, belaglik, nie, onuitvoerbaar, ongenaakbare, herstel word gemaak, ondoenlijk, ondenkbaar, onwerkbaar,
Evidentials|Evidentials
Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate evidentials. An evidential is when the speaker indicates the source of the information on which an assertion about a situation is based. The following definitions are taken from Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca. 1994. The evolution of grammar. Chicago and London: University of Chicago Press.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir verbale hulpwerkwoorde, affixes, bywoorde en deeltjies wat evidentials aan te dui. &#39;N bewysregtelike is wanneer die spreker dui die bron van die inligting op &#39;n bewering wat oor &#39;n situasie gebaseer is. Die volgende definisies is geneem uit Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, en William Pagliuca. 1994. Die evolusie van grammatika. Chicago en Londen: Universiteit van Chicago Press.
(1) direct evidence: the speaker claims to have witnessed the situation, but does not specify the type of sensory evidence.|(1) direkte getuienis: die spreker beweer het gesien die situasie, maar nie die tipe sensoriese bewyse spesifiseer.
I was there and...,|Ek was daar en ...
(2) visual evidence: the speaker claims to have seen the situation described.|(2) visuele bewyse: die spreker beweer dat hy gesien het die situasie beskryf.
with my own eyes I saw...,|met my eie oë sien ek ...
(3) auditory evidence: the speaker claims to have heard the situation described.|(3) ouditiewe bewyse: die spreker beweer die beskryf situasie gehoor het.
with my own ears I heard...,|met my eie ore hoor ek ...
(4) sensory evidence: the speaker claims to have physically sensed the situation described. This can be in opposition to one or both of the above senses (i.e. any other sense), or it can indicate sensory evidence that is not further specified (i.e. any sensory evidence).|(4) sensoriese bewyse: die spreker beweer fisies het voel die situasie beskryf. Dit kan in die opposisie te een of albei van die bogenoemde sintuie (dws enige ander sin), of dit kan sensoriese bewyse dat nie verder gespesifiseer (dws enige sensoriese bewyse) aan te dui.
(5) indirect evidence: the speaker claims not to have witnessed the situation, but does not specify further whether the evidence is reported or simply inferred.|(5) indirekte bewyse: die spreker beweer nie gesien het van die situasie, maar nie verder spesifiseer of die getuienis berig of bloot afgelei.
I wasn't there but...,|Ek was nie daar nie, maar ...,
(6) reported evidence: the speaker claims to know of the situation described via verbal means, but does not specify whether it is second-hand, hearsay, or via folklore.|(6) berig bewyse: die spreker beweer om te weet van die beskryf via verbale middel situasie, maar nie spesifiseer of dit is die tweede-hand, hoorsê, of via folklore.
I heard that...,|Ek het gehoor dat ...,
(7) second-hand evidence: the speaker claims to have heard of the situation described from someone who was a direct witness.|(7) tweedehandse bewyse: die spreker beweer het gehoor van die beskryf van iemand wat &#39;n direkte getuienis was situasie.
(8) evidence from hearsay: the speaker claims to have heard about the situation described, but not from a direct witness.|(8) bewys van hoorsê: die spreker beweer gehoor het oor die situasie beskryf, maar nie van &#39;n direkte getuienis.
it is rumored that...,|dit is gerugte dat ...,
(9) evidence from folklore: the speaker claims that the situation described is part of established oral history (e.g., mythology).|(9) bewyse uit folklore: die spreker beweer dat die situasie beskryf is deel van gevestigde mondelinge geskiedenis (bv mitologie).
according to our ancestors...,|volgens ons voorouers ...
(10) inferred evidence: the speaker infers the event/action, but does not specify whether the inference is based on observable results or on a purely mental process.|(10) afgeleide getuienis: die spreker insinueer die gebeurtenis / aksie, maar spesifiseer nie of die afleiding is gebaseer op waarneembare resultate of op &#39;n suiwer geestelike proses.
(11) inference from results: the speaker infers the situation described from the evidence at hand (i.e. from the observable results of the causing event/action.)|(11) afleiding van resultate: die spreker insinueer die beskryf van die getuienis in die hand situasie (dws vanaf die waarneembare resultate van die veroorsaak gebeurtenis / aksie.)
from the results I would say...,|uit die resultate wat ek sou sê ...,
(12) inference from reasoning: the speaker infers the situation described on the basis of intuition, logic, a dream, previous experience, or some other mental construct.|(12) afleiding van redenasie: die spreker insinueer die beskryf op grond van intuïsie, logika, &#39;n droom, vorige ervaring, of &#39;n ander geestelike konstruk situasie.
I figure that..., I conclude that...,|Ek vind dat ..., ek aflei dat ...,
Evaluator|Evalueerder
Use this domain for words indicating who is evaluating the proposition.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde aandui wat die evaluering van die stelling.
(1) What words indicate who is evaluating the proposition?|(1) Watter woorde dui wat die evaluering van die stelling?
to, in my opinion,|om, in my mening,
(2) What words indicate that you heard what you are saying from someone else?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat jy hoor wat jy sê van iemand anders?
according to, rumor has it, they say, people say, there is talk of, apparently, supposedly, be rumored to be,|volgens, gerugte het dit, sê hulle, die mense sê, is daar sprake van, blykbaar, vermoedelik, word bespiegel dat dit,
Yes|Ja
Use this domain for words that affirm or agree with the truth of something, or that answer a yes/no question in the affirmative.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat bevestig of saamstem met die waarheid van iets, of wat antwoord op &#39;n ja / nee vraag bevestigend.
(1) What words are used to affirm the truth of something?|(1) Watter woorde word gebruik om die waarheid van iets bevestig?
yes, yeah, yea, indeed, true, that's true, it is true, verily, agreed, certainly, of course, that's right, I guess so, that is so, a-huh, nod your head, affirmative, positive|Ja, ja, ja, ja, waar, dit is waar, dit is waar, voorwaar ooreengekom, seker, natuurlik, dit is reg, ek dink so, dat dit so is, &#39;n huh, knik jou kop, regstellende, positiewe
(2) What words are used to refer to the action of affirming the truth of something?|(2) Watter woorde gebruik om te verwys na die optrede van die waarheid van iets bevestig?
affirm, affirmation, confirm, concur, agree, agreement|bevestig, bevestiging, bevestig, eens, stem saam, ooreenkoms
No, not|Nee, nie
Use this domain for words that negate or deny the truth of something, or that answer a yes/no question in the negative.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat ontken of die waarheid van iets ontken nie, of dat &#39;n antwoord ja / nee vraag in die negatief.
(1) What words are used to negate the truth of something?|(1) Watter woorde word gebruik om die waarheid van iets ontken?
no, none, not, nay, uh-uh, no one, nothing, never, nowhere, no indeed, by no means, certainly not, most certainly not, absolutely not, shake your head, negative|ja, niemand, nie, nee, uh-uh, niemand, niks, nooit, nêrens, geen inderdaad op geen manier, beslis nie, beslis nie, absoluut nie, skud jou kop, negatiewe
(2) What words are used to refer to the process of denying the truth of something?|(2) Watter woorde gebruik om te verwys na die proses van die waarheid van iets ontken?
deny, denial, negate, negation, disavow, disavowal, contradict, contradiction, repudiate, repudiation|ontken, ontkenning, ontken, ontkenning, verloën, ontkenning, weerspreek, teenstrydigheid, verwerp, verwerping
(3) What are the noun forms of these words?|(3) Wat is die naamwoord vorme van hierdie woorde?
Markers expecting an affirmative answer|Merkers verwag &#39;n regstellende antwoord
Use this domain for words indicating that an affirmative answer is expected to a question.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat &#39;n regstellende antwoord sal na verwagting &#39;n vraag.
(1) What words are used to indicate that an affirmative answer is expected to a question?|(1) Watter woorde word gebruik om aan te dui dat &#39;n regstellende antwoord verwag om &#39;n vraag?
n't,|nie,
Markers expecting a negative answer|Merkers verwag &#39;n negatiewe antwoord
Use this domain for words indicating that a negative answer is expected to a question.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat &#39;n negatiewe antwoord is verwag om &#39;n vraag.
(1) What words are used to indicate that a negative answer is expected to a question?|(1) Watter woorde word gebruik om aan te dui dat &#39;n negatiewe antwoord is verwag om &#39;n vraag?
n't...are you,|nie ... is jy,
Subordinating particles|Ondergeskik deeltjies
Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate a subordinate clause. The following definitions are taken from Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca. 1994. The evolution of grammar. Chicago and London: University of Chicago Press.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir verbale hulpwerkwoorde, affixes, bywoorde en deeltjies wat &#39;n bysin aan te dui. Die volgende definisies is geneem uit Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, en William Pagliuca. 1994. Die evolusie van grammatika. Chicago en Londen: Universiteit van Chicago Press.
(1) subordinating: Often there are special verb forms or morphemes associated with the verb that occur obligatorily in subordinate clauses of certain types. The extent to which such morphemes can be said to have "meaning" varies, since they often co-occur with other markers of subordination. Their function is primarily to signal the type of subordinate clause.|(1) ondergeskik: Dikwels is daar spesiale werkwoordvorme of morfeme wat verband hou met die werkwoord wat verpligtend in voorkom in bysinne van sekere tipes. Die mate waarin sodanige morfeme kan gesê het &quot;wat beteken&quot; wissel, aangesien hulle dikwels saam voorkom met ander merkers van ondergeskiktheid. Hulle funksie is hoofsaaklik om die tipe bysin sein.
(2) Complement clauses: A main verb may take as its direct object a clause. These are often referred to as "Noun clauses" or "Noun complements". The verb form of the subordinate clause is usually determined by the semantics of the main verb, so in this case, our meaning labels will just refer to the context. If a verb form occurs in the complements to words of thinking and believing, the meaning label will be complement to words of thinking and believing.|(2) Komplement klousules: &#39;n hoofwerkwoord kan neem as sy direkte voorwerp &#39;n klousule. Dit is dikwels na verwys as &quot;Noun klousules&quot; of &quot;Noun aanvulling&quot;. Die werkwoord vorm van die bysin word gewoonlik bepaal deur die semantiek van die hoofwerkwoord, so in hierdie geval, sal ons betekenis etikette net verwys na die konteks. As &#39;n werkwoord vorm kom in die aanvulling om woorde te dink en glo, sal die betekenis etiket aanvul om woorde van denke en glo.
(3) complement to words of thinking|(3) vul om woorde van denke
(4) complement to words of believing|(4) aan te vul om woorde van geloof
(5) complement to words of saying|(5) aan te vul om woorde te sê
(6) complement to words of ordering (in English we use an infinitive with these words)|(6) aanvul om woorde van die bestel (in Engels gebruik ons ​​&#39;n infinitief met hierdie woorde)
(7) complement to words of wanting (again in English these are done with infinitives)|(7) aanvul om woorde te wil (weer in Engels word dit gedoen met infinitiewe)
(8) complement to words of emotion (surprise, regret, happiness, sadness, etc.; the complement proposition is presupposed to be true)|(8) aanvul om woorde van emosie (verrassing, spyt, geluk, hartseer, ens .; die komplement stelling veronderstel om waar te wees)
(9) complement to words of obligation|(9) aanvul om woorde van verpligting
(10) complement to words of admonition|(10) aanvul om woorde van vermaning
(11) subsequent: following a reference time in the past.|(11) die daaropvolgende: ná &#39;n verwysing tyd in die verlede.
(12) subordinator: marker indicates that the verb is in a subordinate clause.|(12) subordinator: merker dui daarop dat die werkwoord is in &#39;n bysin.
Adverbial clauses|Bywoordelike klousules
Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate adverbial clauses. The following definitions are taken from Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca. 1994. The evolution of grammar. Chicago and London: University of Chicago Press.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir verbale hulpwerkwoorde, affixes, bywoorde en bywoordelike deeltjies wat klousules aan te dui. Die volgende definisies is geneem uit Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, en William Pagliuca. 1994. Die evolusie van grammatika. Chicago en Londen: Universiteit van Chicago Press.
(1) There are a variety of adverbial clauses (other than conditional clauses) that sometimes require a special verb form. The meaning labels for these uses are coded according to the type of clause (purpose, concessive, etc.), whether any particular temporal deixis is part of the meaning, and under "co-occurrence restrictions," whether a particular conjunction is present. The types of clauses we might run into are:|(1) Daar is &#39;n verskeidenheid van (behalwe voorwaardelike klousules) bywoordelike klousules wat soms &#39;n spesiale werkwoord vorm vereis. Die betekenis etikette vir hierdie gebruike gekodeer volgens die tipe van klousule (doel, opeenvolging, ens), of enige spesifieke tydelike Deixis is deel van die betekenis, en onder &quot;mede-voorkoms beperkings,&quot; of &#39;n bepaalde samehang teenwoordig is. Die tipes klousules ons kan loop in is:
(2) purpose: the clause states the purpose for which the main clause action is taking place. Often called a "final" clause: 'He was saving his money so that his son could go to college'.|(2) doel: die klousule bepaal die doel waarvoor die hoofsin aksie plaasvind. Dikwels &#39;n &quot;finale&quot; klousule: &quot;Hy is die redding van sy geld sodat sy seun kan gaan na kollege.
so that|sodat
(3) concessive: translated in English as 'although, even though, despite the fact that': 'She was saving her money, even though she was a wealthy woman'.|(3) opeenvolging: in Engels vertaal as &quot;Alhoewel, selfs al is, ten spyte van die feit dat &#39;:&#39; Sy was die redding van haar geld, selfs al het sy &#39;n ryk vrou.
although, even though, despite the fact that|Alhoewel, selfs al is, ten spyte van die feit dat
Case|Geval
Each verb has a set of semantic case relations. For instance in the sentence 'I gave flowers to my wife' the verb give has three case relations. 'I' is the Agent,|Elke werkwoord het &#39;n stel van semantiese geval verhoudings. Byvoorbeeld in die sin &quot;Ek blomme gegee het aan my vrou die werkwoord give het drie geval verhoudings. &quot;Ek&quot; is die agent,
'flowers' is the Patient, and 'my wife is the 'Recipient'. In this sentence the only word that marks a case relation is 'to'. English often marks case relations by their position in the sentence. Some languages mark case relations by affixes, prepositions, postpositions, and sometimes special verbs. To completely describe a language, each verb must be investigated, all its case relations must be identified, and all the ways in which these relations are marked must be described. Since verbs are often unique and unpredictable in their case relations, this information should go into the dictionary. This section should be used to classify the words and affixes that are used to mark case relations. This domain should be used for technical terms that refer to case.|&#39;Blomme&#39; is die pasiënt, en &quot;My vrou is die &#39;ontvanger&#39;. In hierdie sin is die enigste woord wat &#39;n saak betrekking punte is &#39;na&#39;. English punte dikwels geval verhoudings deur hul posisie in die sin. Sommige tale merk geval verhoudings deur affixes, voorsetsels, postpositions, en soms spesiale werkwoorde. Om &#39;n taal heeltemal beskryf, moet elke werkwoord ondersoek, al sy geval verhoudings moet geïdentifiseer word, en al die maniere waarop hierdie verhoudings is gemerk moet beskryf word. Sedert werkwoorde is dikwels unieke en onvoorspelbare in hul saak verhoudings, moet hierdie inligting te gaan in die woordeboek. Hierdie afdeling moet gebruik word om die woorde en affixes wat gebruik word om verhoudings te merk geval te klassifiseer. Hierdie domein gebruik moet word vir die tegniese terme wat verwys na die geval.
(1) What words are used to refer to case?|(1) Watter woorde gebruik om te verwys na die geval?
case, declension|geval, verbuiging
Primary cases|Primêre gevalle
Use this section for primary cases.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir primêre sake.
(1) What words indicate the subject of a sentence?|(1) Watter woorde dui die onderwerp van &#39;n sin?
(2) What words indicate the object of a sentence?|(2) Watter woorde dui die voorwerp van &#39;n sin?
(3) What words indicate the indirect object of a sentence?|(3) Watter woorde dui die indirekte voorwerp van &#39;n sin?
to,|om,
Beneficiary of an event|Begunstigde van &#39;n gebeurtenis
Use this domain for words that mark the beneficiary of an event. The sentence "John built a house for his father" is ambiguous. If the house was for his father to live in, then "for" would mark the 'Beneficiary of a patient', meaning that the house was for the father. If, on the other hand, the father was intending to build the house to sell, but couldn't due to an injury, then "for" would mark the 'Beneficiary of an event', meaning the father benefited from the building of the house.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde dat die begunstigde van &#39;n gebeurtenis te merk. Die sin &quot;John het &#39;n huis vir sy vader&quot; is dubbelsinnig. As die huis was vir sy pa om in te woon, dan &quot;vir&quot; sou die &#39;Begunstigde van &#39;n pasiënt se merk, wat beteken dat die huis was vir die pa. As, aan die ander kant, was die vader van voorneme is om die huis te verkoop bou, maar kon nie as gevolg van &#39;n besering, dan &quot;vir&quot; sou die &#39;Begunstigde van &#39;n gebeurtenis&#39; merk, wat beteken dat die vader voordeel getrek het uit die gebou van die huis.
(1) What words mark the beneficiary of an event?|(1) Watter woorde merk die begunstigde van &#39;n gebeurtenis?
for, for (someone's) sake, for the sake of, for (someone's) benefit, for the benefit of|Want vir (iemand se) ontwil, ter wille van, (iemand se) voordeel, vir die voordeel van
Instrument|Instrument
Use this domain for words that mark an instrument used to do something.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat &#39;n instrument wat gebruik word om iets te doen te merk.
(1) What words mark the instrument used to do something?|(1) Watter woorde merk die instrument wat gebruik word om iets te doen?
with, using|met, die gebruik van
Means|Middel
Use this domain for words indicating the means by which something is done.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat die manier waarop iets gedoen word.
(1) What words indicate the means by which something is done?|(1) Watter woorde dui die wyse waarop iets gedoen word?
by, by means of|deur deur middel van
Way, manner|Manier, wyse
Use this domain for words indicating the way or manner in which something is done.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat die manier of wyse waarop iets gedoen word.
(1) What words indicate the way you do something or the way something is done?|(1) Watter woorde dui die manier waarop jy iets of die manier iets te doen word gedoen?
way, manner, style, fashion, how, thus, mode,|manier, wyse, styl, mode, hoe dus af,
(2) What question words ask for the manner in which something is done?|(2) Watter vraag woorde vra vir die wyse waarop iets gedoen word?
(3) What words indicate that something is done in a particular way?|(3) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets gedoen word in &#39;n bepaalde manier?
in a ... way/manner/fashion, with, like, along ... lines, as if, as though, with an air of,|in &#39;n ... manier / wyse / mode, met, soos, saam ... lyne, asof, as al is, met &#39;n lug van,
(4) What words indicate the way in which something happened?|(4) Watter woorde dui die manier waarop iets gebeur?
in,|in,
Attendant circumstances|Attendant omstandighede
Use this domain for words indicating the attendant circumstances in which something happened.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat die gepaardgaande omstandighede waarin iets gebeur.
(1) What words indicate attendant circumstances?|(1) Watter woorde dui gepaardgaande omstandighede?
in|in
Spatial location of an event|Ruimtelike plek van &#39;n gebeurtenis

at|by

source, from|bron van

Origin (of a person)|Oorsprong (van &#39;n persoon)
Use this domain for words that mark the place where someone was born or the place where they have been living.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde dat die plek waar iemand gebore of die plek waar hulle woon te merk.
