from, be from (the tribe, or country),|uit, vanaf (die stam, of land),
(2) What words refer to the place where a person is from?|(2) Watter woorde verwys na die plek waar &#39;n persoon is van?
home town,|tuisdorp,
Semantically similar events|Semanties soortgelyke gebeure
Use this section for words that join semantically similar events into one sentence. Each sentence is actually reporting two or more situations, which may differ in one or two respects. The words to be included in these domains indicate that two situations are being reported, or mark the differences between the two situations.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir woorde wat semanties soortgelyke gebeure te sluit in een sin. Elke sin is eintlik verslagdoening twee of meer situasies, wat kan verskil in een of twee opsigte. Die woorde word ingesluit in hierdie domeine dui dat twee situasies word berig, of merk die verskille tussen die twee situasies.
Together|Saam
Use this domain for words indicating when two or more people each do the same thing and do it together, or when they do it separately.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde aandui wanneer twee of meer mense elke dieselfde ding doen en saam te doen, of wanneer hulle dit doen afsonderlik.
(1) What words indicate that some people do something together?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat &#39;n paar mense saam iets te doen?
together,|saam,
(2) What words indicate that some people do something separately?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat sommige mense iets te doen afsonderlik?
separately,|afsonderlik,
With, be with|Met, met
Use this domain for words indicating a person who accompanied the subject of a proposition.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde dui op &#39;n persoon wat die onderwerp van &#39;n proposisie vergesel.
(1) What words indicate a person who accompanied the person who is the subject of the clause?|(1) Watter woorde dui op &#39;n persoon wat die persoon wat die onderwerp van die klousule vergesel?
with, be accompanied by, company, in someone's company, in someone's presence, contact, along with, together with,|met, vergesel deur die maatskappy, in iemand se maatskappy, in iemand se teenwoordigheid, kontak, saam met, tesame met,
With, do with someone|Met doen met iemand
Use this domain for words indicating a person who does something with another person who is the subject of the sentence.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde dui op &#39;n persoon wat iets doen met &#39;n ander persoon wat die onderwerp van die sin.
(1) What words indicate someone who goes somewhere with another person?|(1) Watter woorde dui iemand wat iewers gaan saam met &#39;n ander persoon?
with, along,|met, saam,
(2) What words indicate someone who does something with another person?|(2) Watter woorde dui iemand wat iets doen met &#39;n ander persoon?
with, in conjunction with, in partnership with, in collaboration with, side by side with, shoulder to shoulder with,|met, in samewerking met, in vennootskap met, in samewerking met, sy aan sy met, skouer aan skouer met,
(3) What words indicate someone who does something bad with another person?|(3) Watter woorde dui iemand wat iets sleg met &#39;n ander persoon doen?
in league with, in collusion with, in cahoots with, hand in glove with,|in die liga met, in samewerking met, kop in een mus met, hand in een mus met,
(4) What words refer to someone who does something with another person?|(4) Wat woorde verwys na iemand wat iets doen met &#39;n ander persoon?
partner, companion, fellow (student), sidekick,|vennoot, metgesel, mede (student), makker,
Each other|Mekaar
Use this domain for words indicating that two or more people do something to each other.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat twee of meer mense iets om mekaar te doen.
(1) What words indicate that two people do something to each other?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat twee mense iets te doen aan mekaar?
each other, one another, each...the other, exchange, trade, reciprocate,|mekaar, mekaar, elk ... die ander, ruil, handel, heen en weer,
(2) What words describe something that people do to each other?|(2) Watter woorde iets wat mense doen om mekaar te beskryf?
mutual, reciprocal, two-way,|wedersydse, wederkerige, tweerigting-,
In groups|In groepe
Use this domain for words indicating that the subjects of a clause do something in groups.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat die vakke van &#39;n klousule iets in groepe te doen.
(1) What words indicate that something is done in groups?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets gedoen word in groepe?
in, by|in, deur
Patient-related cases|Pasiënt-verwante sake
Use this section for cases that bear a relationship to the 'Patient' of a proposition.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir gevalle wat &#39;n verhouding met die &quot;Pasiënt &#39;n stelling te dra.
Beneficiary (of a patient)|Begunstigde (van &#39;n pasiënt)
Use this domain for words that mark the beneficiary of the Patient of an activity. The Patient is often expressed as the object of a sentence. In the sentence|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde dat die begunstigde van die pasiënt van &#39;n aktiwiteit te merk. Die pasiënt is dikwels uitgedruk as die voorwerp van &#39;n sin. In die sin
"John built a house for his parents," the house is the Patient. It is the house that benefits the parents, not the building of the house.|&quot;John het &#39;n huis vir sy ouers,&quot; het die huis is die pasiënt. Dit is die huis wat die ouers, nie die bou van die huis bevoordeel.
(1) What words mark the beneficiary of a Patient?|(1) Watter woorde merk die begunstigde van &#39;n pasiënt?
for|vir
(2) In English the Beneficiary can be the object, but many languages do not allow this.|(2) In Engels die begunstigde kan die voorwerp nie, maar baie tale nie hierdie nie toelaat nie.
Recipient (of a patient)|Ontvanger (van &#39;n pasiënt)
Use this domain for words that mark the recipient of the Patient of an activity. The Patient is usually expressed as the object of a sentence.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde dat die ontvanger van die pasiënt van &#39;n aktiwiteit te merk. Die pasiënt is gewoonlik uitgedruk as die voorwerp van &#39;n sin.
(1) What words mark the recipient of a patient?|(1) Watter woorde merk die ontvanger van &#39;n pasiënt?
to|om
(2) In English the Recipient can be the object, but many languages do not allow this.|(2) In Engels die Ontvanger kan die voorwerp nie, maar baie tale nie hierdie nie toelaat nie.
With (a patient)|Met (&#39;n pasiënt)
Use this domain for words that mark a second Patient that accompanies the primary Patient of an activity. In this type of sentence there are actually two Patients, but one of them has more prominence than the other. The primary patient is usually expressed as the object of the sentence. The second Patient may be marked by an oblique case or preposition/postposition. For instance it may be conceived as accompanying the first Patient.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde dat &#39;n tweede pasiënt wat die primêre Patient van &#39;n aktiwiteit gepaard merk. In hierdie tipe van vonnis daar is eintlik twee pasiënte nie, maar een van hulle het meer prominensie as die ander. Die primêre pasiënt word gewoonlik uitgedruk as die voorwerp van die sin. Die tweede pasiënt kan gekenmerk deur &#39;n skuins geval of voorsetsel / post posisie. Byvoorbeeld kan dit bedoel as begeleiding van die eerste pasiënt.
(1) What words mark something that is used with another thing?|(1) Watter woorde iets wat gebruik word met &#39;n ander ding merk?
with, together with, combined with, in combination, in conjunction with, alongside, along with,|met, tesame met, gekombineer met, in kombinasie, in samewerking met, saam met, saam met,
Connected with, related|In verband met, verwante
Use the domains in this section for words that indicate a logical relation between two or more words or sentences. Use this domain for words that indicate an unspecified logical relation between people, things, or situations.|Gebruik die domeine in hierdie artikel vir woorde wat &#39;n logiese verhouding tussen twee of meer woorde of sinne te dui. Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat &#39;n ongespesifiseerde logiese verhouding tussen mense, dinge of situasies aan te dui.
(1) What words indicate that two things or situations are connected somehow?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat twee dinge of situasies of ander manier verbind?
be connected (with), be related (to), be linked (with), be associated (with), there is a link between, there is a connection between, be bound up with, go hand in hand, relate, relation, be a relationship between, relationship, have something to do with, be something to do with, be intertwined, tied, pertain, be relative to,|verbind (met), verband (om), gekoppel (met), geassosieer word (met), is daar &#39;n skakel tussen, daar is &#39;n verband tussen, word gebind met, gaan hand aan hand, hou verband, verband, &#39;n verhouding tussen, verhouding, het iets te doen met iets te doen met, word verweef, vasgebind, betrekking, wees relatief tot,
(2) What words indicate that two people are connected somehow?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat twee mense een of ander manier verbind?
be connected with, have links, have connections with, be linked with,|word in verband met, bande, het verbindings met gekoppel word met,
(3) What words indicate that two things are connected because they are similar in some way?|(3) Watter woorde aan te dui dat twee dinge is verbind, want hulle is soortgelyk in een of ander manier?
related, associated, allied,|verwant is, verband hou, verbonde,
(4) What words indicate that several things are connected somehow?|(4) Watter woorde aan te dui dat &#39;n hele paar dinge op &#39;n manier verbind?
interconnected, interrelated,|verbind, onderling,
(5) What words refer to showing that there is a connection between two things?|(5) Wat woorde verwys na wat toon dat daar &#39;n verband tussen twee dinge?
connect, link, associate, make a connection, establish a link, establish a connection, relate, correlate,|koppel, koppel, assosieer, maak &#39;n verband, vestig &#39;n skakel, &#39;n verband te vestig, het betrekking, korreleer,
(6) What words refer to something that connects two things?|(6) Watter woorde verwys na iets wat twee dinge verbind?
connection, relationship, link (between), point of contact, association, tie, relation, correlation, interplay,|verband, verhouding, skakel (tussen), punt van kontak, samewerking, das, verhouding, korrelasie, wisselwerking,
(7) What words indicate that there is no connection between two things?|(7) Wat woorde aan te dui dat daar geen verband is tussen twee dinge?
no connection, unrelated, unconnected,|geen verband, onverwante, verbonde,
(8) What words indicate that something someone says has no connection with the topic being discussed?|(8) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets of iemand sê het geen verband met die onderwerp wat bespreek word?
irrelevant, be beside the point, have nothing to do with, be nothing to do with, be neither here nor there, doesn't come into it, be a red herring,|irrelevant, wees langs die punt, het niks te doen met, wees niks te doen met, wees nie te sê nie, nie in dit kom, word &#39;n rooi haring,
Coordinate relations|Koördineer verhoudings
Use this section for words indicating coordinate relations. Do not put any words in this domain. It is only for organizational purposes.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir woorde aandui koördineer verhoudings. Moenie enige woorde sit nie in hierdie domein. Dit is net vir organisatoriese doeleindes.
And, also|En ook
Use this domain for words that indicate that you are adding another thought to a previous thought. Words in this domain may indicate a variety of relationships between words, phrases, clauses, or sentences. For instance the words may join two clauses that are the same except that the subjects are different, or the objects are different, or the verbs are different.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat daarop dui dat jy die toevoeging van &#39;n ander gedagte om &#39;n vorige denke. Woorde in hierdie domein kan &#39;n verskeidenheid van verhoudings tussen woorde, frases, klousules, of sinne aan te dui. Byvoorbeeld die woorde kan aansluit twee klousules wat dieselfde, behalwe dat die vakke is anders, of die voorwerpe is anders, of die werkwoorde is verskillend is.
(1) What words indicate that you are adding another thought to a previous one?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat jy die toevoeging van &#39;n ander gedagte om &#39;n vorige een?
and, also, too, besides, besides this, as well, so do I/so has she/so are they, in addition, not to mention, likewise, both...and, and also, again, further, in addition to, not only...but also, some...others, first...then, let me add|en ook, ook, behalwe, behalwe dit, so goed, so ek / so het sy / so is hulle, benewens, om nie te praat, net so, beide ... en, en ook weer verder, benewens om nie net ... maar ook &#39;n paar ... ander, eerste ... dan, laat my by te voeg
(2) What words indicate that you are adding something new to what you just said?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat jy iets nuuts wat jy nou net gesê en bygevoeg?
and, also, furthermore, moreover, what's more, besides, by the way, incidentally,|en ook verder ook, wat meer is, behalwe, op die pad, terloops,
(3) What words indicate that you could add more things to the end of a list?|(3) Watter woorde aan te dui dat jy meer dinge kon toevoeg tot die einde van &#39;n lys?
and so on, and so on and so forth, et cetera, etc, and whatever, or whatever, and the like, and suchlike,|en so aan, en so aan en so voort, ensovoorts, ensovoorts, en wat ook al, of wat ook al, en dies meer, en dergelike,
(4) What words indicate that you are adding another in a list of thoughts?|(4) Watter woorde aan te dui dat jy die toevoeging van &#39;n ander in &#39;n lys van gedagtes?
first, second, third, firstly, secondly, thirdly, in the first/second/third place, first of all, to begin with, to start with, finally, lastly, to conclude, in conclusion, last but not least,|eerste, tweede, derde, eerstens, tweedens, derdens, in die eerste / tweede / derde plek, die eerste van alles, om mee te begin, om te begin met, uiteindelik, laastens, om af te sluit, ten slotte, laaste maar nie die minste nie,
Or, either|Of, hetsy
Use this domain for words indicating an alternative relation between two things or propositions.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde dui op &#39;n alternatiewe verband tussen twee dinge of stellings.
(1) What words indicate alternative relation?|(1) Watter woorde dui alternatiewe verhouding?
or, either...or, alternatively, nor, otherwise, alternative, optional,|of, hetsy ... of, alternatiewelik, of, anders, alternatiewe, opsioneel,
Association|Association
Use this domain for words indicating an association between two things.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde dui op &#39;n assosiasie tussen twee dinge.
(1) What words indicate association?|(1) Watter woorde dui assosiasie?
with, among, together with, between...and, be one with, in common, in union with, union|met onder, tesame met tussen ... en, een met, in gemeen het, in die unie met, unie
Combinative relation|Combinative verhouding
Use this domain for words indicating a combinative relation between two things.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde dui op &#39;n combinative verhouding tussen twee dinge.
(1) What words indicate combinative relation?|(1) Watter woorde dui combinative verhouding?
with, together with, combined with, mixed with,|met, tesame met, gekombineer met, gemeng met,
But|Maar
Use this domain for words indicating a contrast between two thoughts that are different in some way.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde dui op &#39;n kontras tussen twee gedagtes wat verskillende ander manier is.
(1) What words indicate that someone wants to do something, but is not able to do it?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iemand wil om iets te doen nie, maar is nie in staat om dit te doen?
but, however,|maar kan egter
(2) What words indicate that something seems to be true, but is not true?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets lyk om waar te wees, maar dit is nie waar nie?
(3) What words indicate that something is true in spite of facts or problems that make it seem unlikely?|(3) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets waar is, ten spyte van feite of probleme wat dit onwaarskynlik laat lyk?
but, yet, still, nevertheless, even so, anyway, all the same, in spite of this, despite this, for all that, though, although,|maar nog steeds, nogtans, selfs so, in elk geval, almal dieselfde, ten spyte van hierdie, ten spyte van hierdie, vir alles wat, al is, hoewel,
(4) What words indicate that an opinion is different than the opinion you have just given?|(4) Watter woorde aan te dui dat &#39;n mening is anders as die mening jy net gegee het?
but, however, on the other hand, at the same time, having said that, mind you,|maar kan egter aan die ander kant, op dieselfde tyd, het gesê dat, dink jy,
(5) What words indicate that something is true of one person or thing, but not true of another?|(5) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets waar is van een persoon of ding, maar nie waar van die ander?
but, however, whereas, while, by contrast, conversely,|maar kan egter, terwyl, terwyl, in teenstelling, omgekeerd,
(6) What words indicate that although one person or thing is similar to another, there is a difference between them?|(6) Watter woorde aan te dui dat hoewel een persoon of ding is soortgelyk aan &#39;n ander, is daar &#39;n verskil tussen hulle?
but, only, except, except for the fact that,|maar net, behalwe, behalwe vir die feit dat,
(7) What words indicate that something could happen, but something else prevented it from happening?|(7) Wat woorde aan te dui dat iets kan gebeur nie, maar iets anders het dit verhoed?
but, only, except,|maar net, behalwe,
(8) What words indicate that the opposite of something is true?|(8) Watter woorde aan te dui dat die teenoorgestelde van iets is waar?
on the contrary, contrary to, in contrast, as opposed to,|inteendeel, in teenstelling met, in teenstelling, in teenstelling met,
Except|Behalwe
Use this domain for words indicating that something is an exception to a group, rule or pattern--something is true of all the things (or people) in a group, but it is not true of one thing.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat daar iets is &#39;n uitsondering op &#39;n groep, reël of patroon - iets is waar van al die dinge (of mense) in &#39;n groep, maar dit is nie waar van een ding.
(1) What words indicate that something is not included in a group, rule, or pattern?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets nie ingesluit in &#39;n groep, reël, of patroon?
except, except for, apart from, aside from, bar, excepting, but for, but, with the exception of, but not,|behalwe, behalwe vir, afgesien van, afgesien van, bar, behalwe, maar nie, maar met die uitsondering van, maar nie,
(2) What words refer to something that is not included in a group?|(2) Watter woorde verwys na iets wat nie ingesluit is in &#39;n groep?
exception,|uitsondering,
Instead|Plaas
Use this domain for words indicating that something is true of one thing (or person) instead of another thing.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat iets waar is van een ding (of persoon) in plaas van &#39;n ander ding.
(1) What words indicate that something is true of one thing instead of another thing?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets waar is van een ding in plaas van &#39;n ander ding?

(2) What words indicate that something is true of one person instead of another person?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets waar is van een persoon in plaas van &#39;n ander persoon?
instead, in someone's place, for, on someone's behalf,|plaas, in iemand se plek, vir, namens iemand se,
Dissociation|Dissosiasie

(1) What words indicate dissociation?|(1) Watter woorde dui dissosiasie?
without, not with, no relationship to, apart from, independent of, from, free from, separated from|sonder, nie met geen verhouding tot, afgesien van, onafhanklik van, van, vry van, geskei van
Distribution|Verspreiding
Use this domain for words indicating that an event is distributed throughout a group, area, or time span.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat &#39;n gebeurtenis is versprei oor die hele groep, area, of tydsverloop.

throughout, through, from...to, after, each, apiece|regdeur, deur, uit ... om, na, elk, elk
Equivalence|Ekwivalensie

Dependency relations|Afhanklikheid verhoudings
Use this domain for words indicating that something is dependent on another thing.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat iets afhanklik ander ding is.
(1) What words express the fact that something is logically dependent on another?|(1) Watter woorde uit te druk van die feit dat daar iets is logies afhanklik mekaar?
to depend on, that depends, depend upon, dependency, dependent, hang on, tied to, lean on, stand on, supportive relationship|afhang van wat afhanklik, afhang, afhanklikheid, afhanklik is, hang, wat gekoppel is aan, leun, staan ​​op, ondersteunende verhouding
Derivation|Afleiding

Limitation of topic|Beperking van die onderwerp

(1) What words indicate the specific area or topic that is being talked about?|(1) Watter woorde dui die spesifieke gebied of onderwerp wat gepraat oor?
specify, specified, specification, specifically in regard to, with regard to, in the case of, concerning, in the area of, in, with, between...and, as touching, particular, particularly, more especially|spesifiseer, verskaf, spesifikasie, spesifiek met betrekking tot, met betrekking tot, in die geval van, aangaande die gebied van, in, met, tussen ... en, soos te raak, veral, veral, veral
In general|In die algemeen
Use this domain for words indicating that something is generally true, but not true in every case.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat daar iets is oor die algemeen waar, maar nie in elke geval.
(1) What words indicate that something is generally true?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat daar iets is oor die algemeen waar?
in general, generally, mostly, on the whole, in most cases,|in die algemeen, oor die algemeen, meestal, oor die algemeen, in die meeste gevalle,
Relations involving correspondences|Verhoudings met ooreenkomste
Use this domain for words indicating relations involving correspondences--a situation in which one thing is the same or similar in some respect to something else.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde aandui verhoudings met ooreenkomste - &#39;n situasie waarin een ding is dieselfde of soortgelyke in sommige opsigte na iets anders.
(1) What words indicate that one thing corresponds to another?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat een ding stem ooreen met &#39;n ander?
correspond to, correspondence, in accordance with, in relation to, according to, in line with, in proportion to, to apply to, to regard as applicable to, in keeping with|ooreenstem met, korrespondensie, in ooreenstemming met, in verband met, volgens, in lyn met, in verhouding tot, om aansoek te doen om te sien as van toepassing op, in ooreenstemming met
Basis|Basis
Use this domain for words indicating that something is the basis for another thing.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat daar iets is die basis vir &#39;n ander ding.
(1) What words indicate that one thing is the basis for another?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat een ding is die basis vir &#39;n ander?
basis, foundation, on the basis of, in view of, by virtue of, be the basis of, form the basis of, on what basis? What do you base your...?|basis, grondslag, op die basis van, in die lig van, uit hoofde van, wees die basis van, vorm die basis van, op watter basis? Wat doen jy baseer jou ...?
Cause|Oorsaak
Use this domain for words that indicate that someone or something is the cause for an event or state, that one event is the cause for another event or state, or that an event or state is reasonable (having sufficient cause). For instance in the sentence, "John caused David to fall," "John caused" is an enabling proposition that brings about the primary proposition "David fell."|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat daarop dui dat iets of iemand is die oorsaak vir &#39;n gebeurtenis of &#39;n staat, dat een gebeurtenis is die oorsaak vir &#39;n ander gebeurtenis of toestand is, of dat &#39;n gebeurtenis of &#39;n staat is redelik (met voldoende rede). Byvoorbeeld in die sin, &quot;John het Dawid om te val,&quot; &quot;John veroorsaak&quot; is &#39;n bemagtigende stelling dat bring die primêre stelling &quot;David het.&quot;
(1) What words indicate that someone caused something to happen?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iemand iets om te gebeur wat veroorsaak?
made, cause|gemaak, oorsaak
(2) What words indicate that something is the cause or reason for an event or state?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat daar iets is die oorsaak of rede vir &#39;n gebeurtenis of toestand?
cause, reason, source, because, because of, for this reason, for the above reasons, for the following reasons, first cause, origin, breed (v), gives birth to, due to, owing to, thus|oorsaak, rede, bron, want as gevolg van, om hierdie rede, vir die bogenoemde redes, vir die volgende redes, die eerste oorsaak, oorsprong, ras (v), gee geboorte aan, as gevolg van, weens, dus
(3) What words indicate that something is reasonable?|(3) Watter woorde aan te dui dat daar iets is redelik?
reasonable|redelike
Reason|Rede
Use this domain for words that reason why someone does something.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat rede waarom iemand iets doen.
(1) What words reason why someone does something?|(1) Watter woorde rede waarom iemand iets?
reason, motive, motivation|rede, motief motivering
(2) What words refer to a reason that explains why something happened?|(2) Watter woorde verwys na &#39;n rede wat verduidelik waarom iets gebeur?
reason, explanation,|Daarom, verduideliking,
Without cause|Sonder oorsaak
Use this domain for words that indicate that an event or state has no cause or reason, or is unreasonable (has insufficient cause).|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat daarop dui dat &#39;n gebeurtenis of &#39;n staat het geen oorsaak of rede, of onredelik (onvoldoende oorsaak).
(1) What words indicate that something has no cause or reason?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets het geen oorsaak of rede?
without cause, unreasonable, without basis, absurd, for no reason, by itself|sonder oorsaak onredelike, sonder basis, absurd, vir geen rede, deur homself
(2) What words indicate that something is contrary to reason?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat daar iets is in teenstelling met rede?
contrary to reason, absurd|Inteendeel om te redeneer, absurd
(3) What words indicate that something is self-caused?|(3) Watter woorde aan te dui dat daar iets is self-veroorsaak?
Result|Gevolg
Use this domain for words indicating that something is the result of another thing.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat daar iets is die gevolg van &#39;n ander ding.
(1) What words indicate the result of something?|(1) Watter woorde dui die gevolg van iets?
result, outcome, end, to result in, to lead to, wages, to end up being, have as a consequence, therefore, so then, consequently, as a result, for this reason, with the result that, so that as a result, to cause, which caused, so that, that, accordingly, then, hence, and so, yield, has the effect of|Gevolglik uitkoms, einde, tot gevolg, lei tot, lone, om uiteindelik &#39;, het as &#39;n gevolg, dus, so dan gevolglik as &#39;n gevolg, om hierdie rede, met die gevolg dat, sodat as &#39;n Gevolglik veroorsaak, wat veroorsaak het, sodat dat daarvolgens, dan hiervandaan en so, opbrengs, het die effek van
Without result|Sonder gevolg
Use this domain for words indicating that something had no result.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat iets nie gevolg gehad het.
(1) What words indicate that something had no result?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat iets nie gevolg gehad?
without result, without effect, in vain, to no avail, with no result, have no discernable effect, pointless, useless, worthless, be left with nothing, not yield|sonder gevolg, sonder effek, tevergeefs, tevergeefs, met geen resultaat, het geen waarneembare effek, nutteloos, nutteloos, waardeloos, gelaat met niks, nie toegee
Purpose|Doel
Use this domain for words indicating that something was done for the purpose of another thing happening.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat iets gedoen vir die doel van &#39;n ander ding om te gebeur.
(1) What words indicate the intended purpose of something?|(1) Watter woorde dui die beoogde doel van iets?
for, for the purpose of, for the sake of, with the purpose of, to, in order to, so that, to show that,|Want vir die doel van, ter wille van die, met die doel om te, om, sodat, om te wys dat,
(2) What words indicate that the purpose is so that something will not happen?|(2) Watter woorde aan te dui dat die doel is so dat iets nie sal gebeur?
in order that...not, so that...not, lest|sodat ... nie, sodat ... nie, sodat
Without purpose|Sonder &#39;n doel
Use this domain for words indicating that something had no purpose.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat iets het geen doel.
(1) What words indicate that there is no purpose to an action?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat daar geen doel om &#39;n aksie?
without purpose, for no purpose, in vain, purposeless, senseless, chance, indiscriminate, meaningless, pointless, undirected,|sonder doel, sonder doel, tevergeefs, doellose, sinnelose, kans, onoordeelkundige, betekenisloos, sinnelose, ongerigte,
Condition|Voorwaarde
Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate a clause in a conditional sentence (If this is true, then that is true). The following definitions are taken from Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca. 1994. The evolution of grammar. Chicago and London: University of Chicago Press.|Gebruik hierdie afdeling vir verbale hulpwerkwoorde, affixes, bywoorde en deeltjies wat &#39;n klousule in &#39;n voorwaardelike vonnis dui (As dit waar is, dan is dit is waar). Die volgende definisies is geneem uit Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, en William Pagliuca. 1994. Die evolusie van grammatika. Chicago en Londen: Universiteit van Chicago Press.
(1) Conditional sentences: Conditional sentences consist of two clauses, the 'if'-clause or protasis (which is a subordinate clause) and the 'then'-clause or apodosis (which is the main clause). Both of these clauses may take special verb forms. (Interestingly enough, they sometime both take the same special verb forms.)|(1) Voorwaardelike sinne: Voorwaardelike sinne bestaan ​​uit twee klousules, die &#39;if&#39;-klousule of protasis (wat is &#39;n bysin) en die&#39; then&#39;-klousule of apodosis (wat is die belangrikste klousule). Beide van hierdie klousules kan spesiale werkwoordvorme neem. (Interessant genoeg, het hulle iewers beide neem dieselfde spesiale werkwoordvorme.)
(2) There are at least three types of conditional sentences. (Labels, explanations, and examples from Li and Thompson 1981): [Li, Charles N., and Sandra A. Thompson. 1981. Mandarin Chinese: A functional reference grammar. Berkeley and Los Angeles: University of California Press.]|(2) Daar is ten minste drie tipes voorwaardelike sinne. (Byskrifte, verduidelikings, en voorbeelde van Li en Thompson 1981): [Li, Charles N., en Sandra A. Thompson. 1981 Mandaryns Chinees: &#39;n funksionele verwysing grammatika. Berkeley en Los Angeles: Universiteit van Kalifornië Press].
(3) reality condition: a conditional relation between two propositions referring to the so-called real world: 'If you see my sister, you will know that she is pregnant'.|(3) werklikheid voorwaarde: &#39;n voorwaardelike verhouding tussen twee stellings verwys na die sogenaamde werklike wêreld: &quot;As jy sien my suster, sal jy weet dat sy swanger is.
(4) hypothetical: the situation is unreal or imagined, but one that could be true: 'If we moved, we could have a garden'.|(4) hipotetiese: die situasie is onwerklik of denkbeeldige, maar een wat ware kan wees: &quot;As ons verhuis het, kon ons &#39;n tuin het.
(5) counterfactual: the proposition describes an unreal or imagined situation that could have been true but was not: 'If you had taken algebra, you would know this formula' (but you did not).|(5) counterfactual: die stelling beskryf &#39;n onwerklik of denkbeeldige situasie wat ware kon gewees het, maar was nie: &quot;As jy algebra geneem het, sou jy hierdie formule ken &#39;(maar jy het nie).
(6) The verb forms that occur in these sentences will be coded according to the type of sentence, and according to which clause of the sentence they occur in.|(6) Die werkwoord vorms wat voorkom in hierdie sinne sal gekodeer word volgens die tipe vonnis, en waarvolgens klousule van die vonnis hulle voorkom in.
(7) Example: the English 'had' + past participle would be coded as:|(7) Voorbeeld: die Engelse &#39;het&#39; + afgelope deelwoord sou gekodeer word as:
(8) meaning label:  protasis|(8) betekenis etiket: protasis
(9) meaning label: counterfactual|(9) beteken etiket: counterfactual
(10) Since the conjunction 'if' obligatorily occurs in the protasis, there will also be the following:|(10) Aangesien die samewerking &quot;as &#39;Verplicht voorkom in die protasis, sal daar ook die volgende:
(11) Co-occurrence restriction: 'if'|(11) Co-voorkoms beperking: &quot;As &#39;
(12) This indicates that a morpheme meaning 'if' obligatorily occurs in the protasis. If no such morpheme is necessary, then there will be no co-occurrence restriction.|(12) Dit dui daarop dat &#39;n morfeem wat beteken &quot;as &#39;Verplicht voorkom in die protasis. Indien geen sodanige morfeem is nodig, dan sal daar geen beperking mede-voorkoms wees.
(13) What words indicate the condition of a conditional sentence?|(13) Watter woorde dui die toestand van &#39;n voorwaardelike vonnis?
condition, if, if indeed, if at all, whether...or, or else, otherwise, unless|toestand, as, as wel, indien enigsins, of ... of, of anders, anders, tensy
Concession|Toegewing
Use this domain for words indicating that the speaker is conceding a point in a debate.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat die spreker afgestaan ​​&#39;n punt in &#39;n debat.
(1) What words indicate that the speaker is conceding a point?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat die spreker afgestaan ​​n punt?
concession, although, though, even though, and yet, even if, nevertheless|toegewing, hoewel, al is, selfs al is, en tog, selfs al nietemin
Discourse markers|Diskoersmerkers
Use this domain for conjunctions and particles that function on the discourse level, and whose meaning and function is uncertain.|Gebruik hierdie domein voegwoorde en deeltjies wat funksioneer op die vlak diskoers, en waarvan die betekenis en funksie is onseker.
(1) What discourse markers are in your language?|(1) Wat diskoersmerkers in jou taal?
just, you know, OK, yeah, like|net, jy weet, OK, ja, soos &#39;
Markers of transition|Merkers van oorgang
Use this domain for conjunctions that simply move the discourse forward without any specific relationship indicated between what comes before and what comes after.|Gebruik hierdie domein voegwoorde wat eenvoudig beweeg die diskoers vorentoe sonder enige spesifieke verhouding aangedui tussen wat kom voor en wat ná kom.
(1) What words are used to join two clauses or sentences without specifying the relationship between them?|(1) Watter woorde word gebruik om twee klousules of sinne te verbind sonder om die verhouding tussen hulle?
and, then, but, now, it happened that, it came to pass that, one day, my next topic is, my next point is, now about|En dan, maar nou, dit gebeur dat toe dat een dag, my volgende onderwerp is, my volgende punt is, nou sowat
Markers of emphasis|Merkers klem
Use this domain for words that indicate that the phrase or sentence is particularly important.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat daarop dui dat die frase of sin is veral belangrik.
(1) What words indicate that a phrase or sentence is important?|(1) Watter woorde aan te dui dat &#39;n frase of sin is belangrik?
then, indeed, surely, so, certainly, in fact, actually, how, you know, really, sure, just, you know don't you that, how much more, emphatically, absolutely, without question, no way, of course, obviously, you've got to be kidding, it is just that, the only thing is, one thing that, in reality, only that, as it were, just as you can see, as you know, without a doubt, don't you remember, I am convinced that|dan inderdaad seker so, seker, in werklikheid, eintlik, hoe, jy weet, regtig, seker, net, jy weet jy nie wat, hoeveel te meer, ten sterkste, absoluut, sonder twyfel, geen manier, natuurlik , natuurlik, jy het om te grap, dit is net dat die enigste ding is, een ding wat, in werklikheid, net dat, as dit was, net soos jy kan sien, soos jy weet, sonder twyfel, don &#39;t jy onthou, is ek oortuig dat
Prompters of attention|Stukkies van die aandag
Use this domain for words that are used to get someone's attention or direct the listener's attention to something. These may use a verb meaning 'look' or 'listen'. Some may be a word specifically referring to attention. Others may be a greeting. Others may be words that refer to non-verbal communication such as clearing your throat.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat gebruik word om iemand se aandag te kry of rig die aandag van die luisteraar se iets. Dit kan &#39;n werkwoord wat beteken &#39;kyk&#39; of &#39;luister&#39; gebruik. Sommige mag &#39;n woord spesifiek te verwys na aandag wees. Ander kan &#39;n groet wees. Ander kan woorde wat verwys na nie-verbale kommunikasie soos die skoonmaak van jou keel.
(1) What words are used to get someone's attention?|(1) Watter woorde word gebruik om iemand se aandag te kry?
you, you there, hey you, hello, excuse me, attention, attention please, may I have your attention please, pay attention, listen up everybody, now hear this, and now for an important announcement, and now for a word from our sponsor, just a moment, wait a minute, lend me your ears, look here, ahem|jou, jy is daar, hey jy, hello, verskoon my, aandag, aandag asseblief, kan ek jou aandag asseblief, aandag, luister up almal, nou hoor dit, en nou vir &#39;n belangrike aankondiging, en nou vir &#39;n woord van ons borg, net &#39;n oomblik, wag &#39;n minuut, leen my jou ore, kyk hier, ahem
(2) What words are used to direct someone's attention to something?|(2) Watter woorde word gebruik om iemand se aandag te vestig op iets?
behold, look, will you look at that, get a load of this, (point)|kyk, kyk, sal jy sien dat die, kry &#39;n las van hierdie, (punt)
(3) What words are used to warn someone of danger?|(3) Watter woorde gebruik om iemand van gevaar te waarsku?
watch out, look out, heads up, hit the dirt, get out of the way, here it comes, oh no, (scream)|kyk uit, kyk uit, die hoof van, druk op die vuil, kry uit die pad, hier kom dit, o nee, (skree)
(4) What non-verbal means are used to get someone's attention|(4) Wat nie-verbale wyse word gebruik om iemand se aandag te kry
clear throat, whistle, raise hand|duidelik keel, fluitjie, verhoog hand
Markers of direct address|Merkers van direkte adres
Use this domain for words that the speaker uses to refer to the person he is addressing. These words are usually used when you start talking to someone, but can be used during a speech or conversation to refer to the person you are talking to.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat die spreker gebruik om te verwys na die persoon wat hy aanspreek. Hierdie woorde word gewoonlik gebruik wanneer jy begin praat met iemand, maar kan gebruik word tydens &#39;n toespraak of &#39;n gesprek te verwys na die persoon wat jy praat.
(1) What words are used when you start talking to someone?|(1) Watter woorde word gebruik wanneer jy begin praat met iemand?
O, sir, ma'am, ladies and gentlemen, men and brothers, (look) you, (listen) all of you|O, meneer, mevrou, dames en here, mans en broers, (kyk) jy, (luister) almal van julle
Markers of identificational and explanatory clauses|Merkers van identifikasie en verduidelikende klousules
Use this domain for words that begin a clause that identifies a specific case or example of what has just been said, or that explains what has just been said. Specific case: I have just mentioned a general class of things or a general idea and want to give a specific example of what I am talking about. Explanation: I have just said something and I think people might misunderstand, so I want to explain what I mean. Digression: I am talking about a particular topic, but want to say something that does not fit into my topic, so I say something that is about a different topic.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat &#39;n klousule wat &#39;n spesifieke geval of voorbeeld van wat daar gesê identifiseer, of wat verduidelik wat net gesê begin. Spesifieke geval: Ek het net genoem &#39;n algemene klas van dinge of &#39;n algemene idee en wil &#39;n spesifieke voorbeeld van wat ek praat gee. Verduideliking: Ek het nou net iets gesê en ek dink mense dalk verkeerd verstaan ​​nie, so ek wil om te verduidelik wat ek bedoel. Inset: ek praat oor &#39;n spesifieke onderwerp, maar wil iets wat nie pas nie in my onderwerp sê nie, so ek iets wat oor &#39;n ander onderwerp sê.
(1) What words are used to identify a specific case?|(1) Watter woorde word gebruik om &#39;n spesifieke geval identifiseer?
that, namely, namely that, that is, i.e.|dat naamlik, naamlik dat, dit is, dws
(2) What words are used to introduce an example?|(2) Watter woorde word gebruik om &#39;n voorbeeld te stel?
for example, e.g., as follows, as below, such as, let me give you an example, to illustrate|byvoorbeeld, bv, soos volg, soos hieronder, soos, laat my gee u &#39;n voorbeeld om te illustreer
(3) What words are used to introduce an explanation?|(3) Watter woorde word gebruik om &#39;n verduideliking te stel?
what I mean is, that is to say, let me add, allow me to explain, it's like|Wat ek bedoel is, dit wil sê, laat my by te voeg, laat my toe om te verduidelik, dit is soos
(4) What words are used to introduce a conclusion?|(4) Watter woorde word gebruik om &#39;n gevolgtrekking te stel?
which shows that, so we find, so we see|wat toon dat, so vind ons, so ons sien
(5) What words mark a digression?|(5) Watter woorde merk &#39;n afwyking?
let me just insert, as an aside, this is off the subject, oh by the way|laat my net te voeg, as &#39;n eenkant, dit is uit die onderwerp, oh op die pad
Markers of focus|Merkers van fokus
Use this domain for words indicating that one of several things is in focus.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat aandui dat een van verskeie dinge in fokus.
(1) What words focus especially on one of several things?|(1) Watter woorde fokus veral op een van verskeie dinge?
especially, particularly, particular, most of all|veral, veral, veral die meeste van almal
Hesitation fillers|Huiwering vullers
Use this domain for words that a speaker uses when he hesitates or pauses while he is speaking in order to think about what he is saying.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat &#39;n spreker gebruik toe hy aarsel of pouses terwyl hy nog praat, ten einde na te dink oor wat hy sê.
(1) What words are used when a speaker hesitates or pauses to think?|(1) Watter woorde word gebruik wanneer &#39;n spreker aarsel of pouses om te dink?
um, uh, er, hmm, yeah, let's see, hold on a minute, let me see, let me think|um, uh, daar, hmm, ja, laat ons sien, hou op &#39;n minuut, laat my sien, laat my dink
Honorifics|Ere
Use this domain for words that the speaker uses to show respect or a lack of respect to the person he is addressing. Some languages have elaborate systems of honorifics. Other languages have none. Languages with a stratified social structure often use honorifics. Egalitarian societies generally lack them, but some egalitarian societies may use them. For instance in Nahuatl there are four levels of honorifics. Level 1 is how one addresses intimates, small children, and pets. Level 2 is for strangers and persons treated formally. Level 3 is for respected persons, the dead, and God. Level 4 is for obsequious respect, as for the archbishop in an interview with a priest, and for ritual kin. (Jane H. Hill and Kenneth C. Hill. 1978. Honorific usage in modern Nahuatl: the expression of social distance and respect in the Nahuatl of the Malinche Volcano area, Language 54:123-155.) In Japanese, which has a stratified social structure, a person uses one set of words and affixes when speaking to someone below you in the social hierarchy, such as your wife, children, and pets. A different set of words is used when speaking to peers. Another set is used when speaking to a superior. A fourth set is used when speaking to the emperor. English used to have two pronouns for second person singular. 'Thou' was used for equals and inferiors, and 'you' was used for superiors. Your language may have special honorific words used as (1) pronouns, (2) affixes, (3) particles, (4) terms of direct address, (5) greetings (6) requests, (7) apologies.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde wat die spreker gebruik om respek of &#39;n gebrek aan respek vir die persoon wat hy aanspreek wys. Sommige tale het uitgebreide stelsels ere. Ander tale het geen. Tale met &#39;n gestratifiseerde sosiale struktuur gebruik dikwels ere. Egalitariese samelewings algemeen nie hulle nie, maar &#39;n paar egalitariese samelewings kan gebruik. Byvoorbeeld in Nahuatl is daar vier vlakke van ere. Vlak 1 is hoe &#39;n mens spreek kenne, klein kinders, en troeteldiere. Vlak 2 is vir vreemdelinge en persone formeel behandel. Vlak 3 is vir gerespekteerde persone, die dood, en God. Vlak 4 is vir kruiperig opsigte, soos vir die aartsbiskop in &#39;n onderhoud met &#39;n priester, en vir rituele naasbestaandes. (Jane H. Hill en Kenneth C. Hill 1978 eervol gebruik in moderne Nahuatl:. Die uitdrukking van sosiale afstand en respek in die Nahuatl van die Malinche Volcano area, taal 54:. 123-155) In Japanese, wat &#39;n gestratifiseerde het sosiale struktuur, &#39;n persoon gebruik &#39;n stel van woorde en affixes wanneer praat om iemand onder julle in die sosiale hiërargie, soos jou vrou, kinders en troeteldiere. &#39;N Ander stel van woorde word gebruik wanneer gepraat eweknieë. &#39;N ander stel word gebruik wanneer gepraat om &#39;n beter. A vierde stel word gebruik wanneer gepraat aan die keiser. Engels gebruik om twee voornaamwoorde vir die tweede persoon enkelvoud het. &#39;Jy&#39; gebruik vir gelykes en minderes, en &#39;jy&#39; is gebruik vir seniors. Jou taal kan spesiale eervol woorde gebruik as (1) voornaamwoorde, (2) affixes, (3) deeltjies, (4) Ingevolge direkte adres, (5) groete (6) versoeke, (7) verskonings hê.
(1) What pronouns are used to show respect or a lack of respect?|(1) Wat voornaamwoorde gebruik word om óf &#39;n gebrek aan respek?
thou (archaic), you (archaic),|U (argaïese), jy (argaïese),
(2) What affixes are used to show respect?|(2) Wat affixes gebruik word om respek?
(3) What particles are used to show respect?|(3) Wat deeltjies word gebruik om respek?
please,|asseblief,
(4) What terms of direct address are used to show respect?|(4) Wat terme van direkte adres word gebruik om respek?
sir, ma'am, your honor, your majesty,|meneer, mevrou, jou eer, U Majesteit,
(5) What words are used in greetings to show respect?|(5) Watter woorde gebruik word in groete aan respek?
hey, hi, hello, pleased to meet you,|hey, hi, hello, bly om jou te ontmoet,
(6) What words are used in requests to show respect?|(6) Watter woorde word gebruik in versoeke om respek?
may, can,|Mei kan,
(7) What words are used in apologies to show respect?|(7) Watter woorde gebruik word in verskonings om respek?
sorry, excuse me, I beg your pardon,|Jammer, verskoon my, ek smeek jou vergewe,
Name|Naam
Use this domain for general words referring to proper nouns--the name given to a particular person or thing to distinguish it from other things like it. Proper nouns are often not included in a dictionary, or are included in an appendix at the front or back of a dictionary. This is because there are so many of them, they are sometimes difficult to define, and it saves space in the dictionary. For instance place names can be included in a map. So it might be good to type the proper nouns into a special file.|Gebruik hierdie domein vir algemene woorde verwys na Woorde - die naam wat gegee word aan &#39;n spesifieke persoon of ding om dit te onderskei van ander dinge soos dit. Woorde is dikwels nie in &#39;n woordeboek, of is ingesluit in &#39;n bylaag aan die voorkant of agterkant van &#39;n woordeboek. Dit is omdat daar so baie van hulle, hulle is soms moeilik om te definieer, en dit spaar ruimte in die woordeboek. Byvoorbeeld plekname kan ingesluit word in &#39;n kaart. So is dit dalk goed wees om die Woorde tik in &#39;n spesiale lêer.
(1) What general words refer to the name of a person, place, or thing?|(1) Watter algemene woorde verwys na die naam van &#39;n persoon, plek of ding?
name, proper noun,|naam, eienaam,
(2) What words refer to giving a name to someone or something?|(2) Watter woorde verwys na die gee van &#39;n naam om iets of iemand?
name (v), call, christen,|naam (v), oproep, Christen,
Name of a person|Naam van &#39;n persoon
Use this domain for words related to the name of a person. Each culture has a system of personal names to identify individuals and kin groups. The subcategories under this heading should reflect the cultural system. If your language has a special set of names that do not fit any of they domains given here, then set up a special domain.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde in verband met die naam van &#39;n persoon. Elke kultuur het &#39;n stelsel van persoonlike name aan individue en familie groepe te identifiseer. Die subkategorieë onder hierdie opskrif moet die kulturele stelsel weerspieël. As jou taal het &#39;n spesiale stel van die name wat nie pas enige van hulle domains gegee, dan &#39;n spesiale gebied.
(1) What words refer to the name of a person?|(1) Watter woorde verwys na die naam van &#39;n persoon?
name, proper name, proper noun, first name, given name, personal name, middle name, last name, family name, father's name, surname, maiden name, initial, title, identity,|naam, behoorlike naam, eienaam, die eerste naam, gegewe naam, persoonlike naam, middel naam, laaste naam, familie naam, die vader se naam, van, nooiensvan, aanvanklike, titel, identiteit,
(2) What words refer to a name your family or friends use for you that is not your real name?|(2) Watter woorde verwys na &#39;n naam van jou familie of vriende vir julle dat nie jou regte naam?
nickname, pet name|bynaam, troeteldier naam
(3) What words refer to a name you use for yourself that is not your real name?|(3) Watter woorde verwys na &#39;n naam wat jy gebruik vir jouself wat nie jou regte naam?
false name, pseudonym, pen name, stage name, alias, a.k.a. (also known as), under the name of, under an assumed name, go by the name of,|vals naam, skuilnaam, pen naam, stadium alias, aka (ook bekend as), onder die naam van, onder &#39;n veronderstelde naam, gaan deur die naam van,
(4) What words are used to refer to someone when you can't remember what they are called?|(4) Watter woorde gebruik om te verwys na iemand wanneer jy nie kan onthou wat hulle genoem?
what's his/her name, whatchamacallit, whatsit, so and so,|Wat is sy / haar naam, dinges, wat&#39;s, so en so,
(5) What words describe someone whose name is not known?|(5) Watter woorde iemand wie se naam nie bekend is nie, beskryf?
anonymous, unnamed, unidentified, incognito, unknown, nameless,|anonieme, naamlose, ongeïdentifiseerde, incognito, onbekende, naamlose,
(6) What words refer to discovering or stating the name of someone whose name has not been known?|(6) Watter woorde verwys na die ontdekking of wat die naam van iemand wie se naam nog nie bekend?
name, identify,|noem, identifiseer,
(7) What words are used to indicate a person's name?|(7) Watter woorde word gebruik om n persoon se naam dui?
someone's name is, be called, be known as, named,|iemand se naam is, word genoem, bekend as die naam,
(8) What words refer to giving someone a name?|(8) Wat woorde verwys na om iemand &#39;n naam?
name (v), call, be christened, give a name to, choose a name, pick a name, call him/her 'name'|naam (v), bel, word gedoop, gee &#39;n naam te kies &#39;n naam, kies &#39;n naam, noem hom / haar &#39;naam&#39;
(9) What words refer to the reason why someone is given a name?|(9) Watter woorde verwys na die rede waarom iemand &#39;n naam gegee?
be named for, be named after, namesake|genoem word, want na sy naam genoem, naamgenoot
(10) When is a name given?|(10) Wanneer is &#39;n naam gegee?
naming ceremony, christening|noem seremonie, doop
(11) What words refer to writing your name?|(11) Watter woorde verwys na die skryf van jou naam?
sign (your name), signature|teken (jou naam), handtekening
Personal names|Persoonlike name
Use this domain for those names that are given to people, that people use to call to each other and to talk about each other.|Gebruik hierdie domein name vir diegene wat gegee word aan mense, wat mense gebruik om te bel om mekaar en om te praat oor mekaar.
(1) What are the given names used by people in the language group?|(1) Wat is die name wat gebruik word deur mense in die taalgroep?
John, David, Mary, Elizabeth|John, David, Maria, Elizabeth
Family names|Familiename
Use this domain for the proper names of the families that exist within the language community. If your culture does not use family names, just leave this domain empty.|Gebruik hierdie domein is vir die behoorlike name van die families wat bestaan ​​binne die taalgemeenskap. As jou kultuur nie familie name gebruik nie, net laat hierdie domein leeg.
(1) What names are used by all the members of a family?|(1) Wat die name gebruik deur al die lede van &#39;n gesin?
Smith, Jones, MacDonald, Johnson|Smith, Jones, MacDonald, Johnson
Clan names|Clan name
Use this domain for the proper names of the clans that exist within the language community. The distinction between family, clan, tribe, and nation is based on politics and emotion. Our purpose here is not to make political statements, but merely to list the names. There may be no distinction between family and clan, in which case ignore this domain and use the domain 'Family names'.|Gebruik hierdie domein is vir die behoorlike name van die stamme wat bestaan ​​binne die taalgemeenskap. Die onderskeid tussen familie, stam, stam en nasie is gebaseer op die politiek en emosie. Ons doel hier is nie om politieke uitsprake te maak nie, maar bloot om &#39;n lys van die name. Daar kan geen onderskeid tussen familie en stam, in welke geval ignoreer hierdie domein en gebruik die domein &#39;Family name&#39; wees.
(1) What are the proper names of the clans?|(1) Wat is die regte name van die stamme?
Hatfields, McCoys, Bear Clan|Hatfields, McCoys, Bear Clan
Tribal names|Stamname
Use this domain for the proper names of the tribes that exist around the language community, including the name of your own tribe. These tribal names may or may not correspond with the names of countries.|Gebruik hierdie domein is vir die behoorlike name van die stamme wat bestaan ​​rondom die taalgemeenskap, insluitend die naam van jou eie stam. Hierdie stamname mag of nie mag nie ooreenstem met die name van lande.
(1) What are the proper names of the neighboring tribes?|(1) Wat is die regte name van die naburige stamme?
Saxons, Scots, Welsh, Picts, Irish, Normans, Vikings, Brits, Americans, Aussies, Kiwis, Sioux, Cherokee|Saksers, Skotte, Welsh, Pikte, Ierse, Normandiërs, Vikings, Brits, Amerikaners, Aussies, Kiwi&#39;s, Sioux, Cherokee
Names of languages|Name van tale
Use this domain for the proper names of the languages that are spoken in the area around the language community, including the name of your own language. These language names may or may not correspond with the names of countries. Do not try to include every language name in the world, only the neighboring and important ones. For instance you might want to include the languages that border your own and the national language. Give the form that you use. For instance the German people call their language 'Deutsch', but in English we call it 'German'.|Gebruik hierdie domein is vir die behoorlike name van die tale wat gepraat word in die gebied rondom die taalgemeenskap, insluitend die naam van jou eie taal. Hierdie taal name mag of nie mag nie ooreenstem met die name van lande. Moenie probeer om elke taal naam in die wêreld nie, net die naburige en belangrike mense in te sluit. Byvoorbeeld, wil jy dalk die tale wat jou eie grens en die nasionale taal in te sluit. Gee die vorm wat jy gebruik. Byvoorbeeld die Duitse volk noem hul taal &#39;Deutsch, maar in Engels ons noem dit&#39; Duitse &#39;.
(1) What are the names of the languages spoken in the area?|(1) Wat is die name van die tale in die gebied gepraat?
English, Gaelic, Irish, Welsh, Dutch, German, French, Spanish, Pidgin English|Engels, Gaelic, Ierse, Walliese, Nederlands, Duits, Frans, Spaans, Pidgin English
Nickname|Bynaam
Use this domain for common nicknames--an additional name given to a person later in life, often descriptive. Also include general names used to call or refer to someone when you don't know their name|Gebruik hierdie domein vir &#39;n gemeenskaplike byname - &#39;n bykomende naam later in die lewe gegee aan &#39;n persoon, wat dikwels beskrywende. Ook algemene name wat gebruik word om te bel of verwys na iemand as jy nie hulle naam ken

buddy, buster, guy, gal, bro, sis|buddy, buster, man, gal, bro, sis

John Doe, Jane Doe, Joe Blow, GI Joe|John Doe, Jane Doe, Joe Blow, GI Joe
Terms of endearment|Terme van troetelnaam
Use this domain for terms of endearment--a name used by lovers or spouses to express love or intimacy. Some languages may have special names used by close friends.|Gebruik hierdie domein terme van troetelnaam - &#39;n naam wat gebruik word deur liefhebbers of gades om liefde of intimiteit uit te druk. Sommige tale kan spesiale name gebruik deur goeie vriende te hê.

sweetheart, honey, dear|liefling, heuning, liewe
Name of a place|Naam van &#39;n plek

Names of countries|Name van lande
Use this domain for the proper names of the countries that exist around the language community, especially those countries where your language is spoken. Include the name of your own country. Do not list every country in the world, unless your language has developed special names or pronunciations for those countries. Include any country that you refer to in your language, especially those names whose pronunciation you have adapted to fit your language. Give the form of the name that you use, rather than the official spelling. For instance the Japanese refer to their country as 'Nihon', but in English will call it 'Japan'. So|Gebruik hierdie domein is vir die behoorlike name van die lande wat bestaan ​​rondom die taalgemeenskap, veral dié lande waar jou taal gepraat. Die naam van jou eie land. Nie elke land in die wêreld nie, tensy jou taal spesiale name of uitsprake ontwikkel vir die lande. Sluit enige land wat jy verwys na in jou taal, veral dié name wie uitspraak jy aangepas om jou taal te pas. Gee die vorm van die naam wat jy gebruik, eerder as die amptelike spelling. Byvoorbeeld die Japannese verwys na hul land as &#39;Nihon, maar in Engels word dit&#39; Japan &#39;noem. So
'Japan' is an English word and should go into an English dictionary. But 'Nihon' is not an English word and should not go in the dictionary.|&#39;Japan&#39; is &#39;n Engelse woord en moet gaan in &#39;n Engelse woordeboek. Maar &#39;Nihon&#39; is nie &#39;n Engelse woord en moet nie gaan in die woordeboek.
(1) What are the proper names of the countries where your language is spoken?|(1) Wat is die regte name van die lande waar jou taal gepraat?
Great Britain, United States of America, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, Ireland|Groot-Brittanje, die Verenigde State van Amerika, Kanada, Australië, Nieu-Seeland, Suid-Afrika, Ierland
(2) What are the proper names of the neighboring countries?|(2) Wat is die regte name van die naburige lande?
Netherlands, Germany, France, Spain, Mexico|Nederland, Duitsland, Frankryk, Spanje, Mexiko
(3) What words are used to refer to a citizen of these countries?|(3) Watter woorde gebruik om te verwys na &#39;n burger van hierdie lande?
Brit, the English, American, Canadian, Aussie, Kiwi|Brit, die Engelse, Amerikaanse, Kanadese, Aussie, Kiwi
Names of regions|Name van streke
Use this domain for the proper names of the regions within your country or language area. Some of these may be political regions. Others may be informal terms. Give the local pronunciation, rather than some foreign spelling. You may want to limit this domain to just those areas within your language area. However if you have special names for areas outside of your language area, for example 'the Mideast', you should include them.|Gebruik hierdie domein is vir die behoorlike name van die streke in jou land of taalgebied. Sommige van hierdie mag wees politieke streke. Ander kan wees informele terme. Gee die plaaslike uitspraak, eerder as &#39;n vreemde spelling. Wil jy dalk hierdie domein beperk tot net dié gebiede binne jou taal area. Maar as jy &#39;n spesiale name vir gebiede buite jou taal area, byvoorbeeld &#39;die Midde-Ooste, moet jy hulle in te sluit.
(1) What are the names of the regions in the area?|(1) Wat is die name van die streke in die area?
Yorkshire, California, Midlands, Midwest, the South, outback|Yorkshire, Kalifornië, Midlands, Weste, die Suide, Outback
Names of cities|Name van stede
Use this domain for the proper names of cities, towns, and villages in the language area. Include the names of important cities outside of the language area if your language has a special name for the city or a different pronunciation for it. It might be good to use a map for this. In fact it is good to include a map of the language area in a published dictionary. If your language area is very large, there may be hundreds or thousands of cities, towns, and villages. In this case you will have to decide which should be included in the dictionary. Or you could decided to list them in a special section.|Gebruik hierdie domein is vir die behoorlike name van stede, dorpe en dorpe in die taalgebied. Sluit die name van belangrike stede buite die taalgebied as jou taal het &#39;n spesiale naam vir die stad of &#39;n ander uitspraak vir dit. Dit mag dalk goed wees om &#39;n kaart te gebruik vir hierdie. In werklikheid is dit is goed om &#39;n kaart van die gebied in &#39;n taal gepubliseer woordeboek sluit. As jou taal area is baie groot, kan daar honderde of duisende van stede, dorpe en dorpe. In hierdie geval sal jy moet besluit wat ingesluit moet word in die woordeboek. Of jy kan besluit om &#39;n lys van hulle in &#39;n spesiale afdeling.
(1) What are the names of the cities in the language area?|(1) Wat is die name van die stede in die taal area?
London, Washington D.C.|Londen, Washington DC
(2) What are the names of districts within a city?|(2) Wat is die name van distrikte binne &#39;n stad?
Westminster, Chelsea|Westminster, Chelsea
Names of streets|Name van strate
Use this domain for the proper names of highways, roads, streets, and trails in the language area. If there are many such names, only include the important names (e.g. King's Highway) or commonly used names (e.g. Main Street).|Gebruik hierdie domein is vir die behoorlike name van paaie, paaie, strate, en paaie in die taalgebied. As daar is baie sulke name, net die belangrike name (bv King&#39;s Highway) of algemeen gebruik name (bv Main Street).
(1) What are the names of the streets in the language area?|(1) Wat is die name van die strate in die taal area?
King's Highway, Highway 66, Main Street, Piccadilly Square, Oregon Trail|King&#39;s Highway, Highway 66, Hoofstraat, Piccadilly Square, Oregon Trail

Name of a thing|Naam van &#39;n ding
Use this domain for words related to the name of a thing. Many cultures give names to particular buildings, ships, airplanes, organizations, companies, schools, and other things. If your language has hundreds of names for some kind of thing, it is best to not try to list them all. But if there are a few important names for one kind of thing, set up a domain for them.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde in verband met die naam van &#39;n ding. Baie kulture gee name aan sekere geboue, skepe, vliegtuie, organisasies, maatskappye, skole, en ander dinge. As jou taal het honderde name vir &#39;n soort van ding, dit is die beste om nie te probeer om hulle almal te lys. Maar as daar &#39;n paar belangrike name vir die een soort van ding, opstel van &#39;n domein vir hulle.
(1) What words refer to a name for something?|(1) Watter woorde verwys na &#39;n naam vir iets?
name, proper name, designation, label, nomenclature, tag, title,|naam, behoorlike naam, benaming, etiket, nomenklatuur, tag, titel,
(2) What words are used to indicate the name of something?|(2) Watter woorde word gebruik om die naam van iets aan te dui?
be called, be known as, be entitled, be termed, go by the name of, so-called,|genoem word, staan ​​bekend as, geregtig, genoem is, gaan deur die naam van sogenaamde,
(4) What words refer to a name that is not correct?|(4) Wat woorde verwys na &#39;n naam wat nie korrek nie?
misnomer,|wanbenaming,
(5) What words describe something that has the name of something but not its qualities?|(5) Watter woorde iets wat die naam van iets, maar nie sy eienskappe het, beskryf?
nominal, in name only,|nominale, net in naam,
(6) What words refer to giving something a name?|(6) Watter woorde verwys na die gee van iets wat &#39;n naam?
call, name, rename,|noem, benoem, hernoem,
Names of animals|Name van diere
Use this domain for words referring to the name of an animal. Some cultures give names to domesticated animals or to animals in stories. Think through each kind of domesticated animal.|Gebruik hierdie domein woorde verwys na die naam van &#39;n dier. Sommige kulture gee name mak diere of diere in stories. Deurdink elke soort mak dier.
